$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-12-7
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1037206-86-2
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1037206-88-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-368-CAS-890411
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 100
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step D - Synthesis of Compound 5E The solution of compound 5D (500 mg,
2.73 mmol) in formamide (6.0 mL) was heated to 150 °C in an oil bath and
stirred for 18 hours. After cooled to room temperature, ethyl acetate
(100 mL) and water (100 mL) were added and the layers were separated. The
organic solution was washed with water (2 x 60 mL), dried over MgSO4 and
concentrated in vacuo to provide the crude product 5E (0.50 g, quant.)
which, was used without further purification. Compound 5E, yield (0.50 g,
quant.). MS found for C9H7FN2O: 179.0 (M+H)+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM other reaction condition gave lower yield
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Tricyclic indole derivatives as HCV NS5B polymerase inhibitors and their
preparation, pharmaceutical compositions and use in the treatment of HCV
infections
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM Step D-Synthesis of Compound 9E. The solution of compound 9D (500 mg,
2.73 mmol) in formamide (6.0 mL) was heated to 150°C in an oil bath and
stirred for 18 hours. After cooled to room temperature, ethyl acetate
(100 mL) and water (100 mL) were added and the layers were separated. The
organic solution was washed with water (2 × 60 mL), dried over MgSO4 and
concentrated in vacuo to provide the crude product 9E (0.50 g, quant.)
which, was used without further purification. MS found for C9H7FN2O:
179.0 (M+H)+.

$DATUM 100
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step D-Synthesis of Compound AA5 The solution of compound AA4 (500 mg,
2.73 mmol) in formamide (6.0 mL) was heated to 150° C. in an oil bath and
stirred for 18 h. After cooled to room temperature, ethyl acetate (100
mL) and water (100 mL) were added and the layers were separated. The
organic solution was washed with water (2×60 mL), dried over MgSO4 and
concentrated in vacuo. The crude product AA5 (0.50 g, quant.) which, was
used without further purification. MS found for C9H7FN2O: 179.0 (M+H)+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 75-12-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step D - Synthesis of Compound AA5. The solution of compound AA4 (500 mg,
2.73 mmol) in formamide (6.0 mL) was heated to 150°C in an oil bath and
stirred for 18 hours. After cooled to room temperature, ethyl acetate
(100 mL) and water (100 mL) were added and the layers were separated. The
organic solution was washed with water (2 × 60 mL), dried over MgSO4 and
concentrated in vacuo to provide the crude product AA5 (0.50 g, quant.)
which, was used without further purification. MS found for C9H7FN2O:
179.0 (M+H)+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of indole derivatives for treating or preventing of HCV and
related viral infections
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

2.73 mmol) in formamide (6.0 mL) was heated to 150°C in an oil bath and
stirred for 18 h. After cooled to room temperature, ethyl acetate (100

$DATUM 10025-87-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(6):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-63-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: To an ice-cooled solution of
1,3-dihydro-6-nitro-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid methyl ester
(7.78 g, 32.8 mmol) in DMF (100 mL) was added 60% sodium hydride (3.94 g,
98.5 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 15 min at the same temperature,
and iodomethane (6.13 mL, 98.5 mmol) was added. Then the reaction mixture
was stirred for 1.5 h at room temperature and poured into water. The
resulting precipitate was collected, washed with water, and dried to
provide
1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-6-nitro-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester (8.58 g, 32.5 mmol) in 99% yield. (3) A suspension of
1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-6-nitro-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester (8.58 g, 32.4 mmol) and 10% Pd/C (1.60 g, containing 50%
water) in ethanol (100 mL) was hydrogenated for 5.5 h under hydrogen
stream at room temperature. After removal of catalyst by filtration
through Celite, the filtrate was evaporated to provide
6-amino-1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester. This compound was used for the next reaction without
further purification. (4) A solution of
6-amino-1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester in forma- mide (100 mL) was heated for 2 h at 190°C. The
reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature and poured into water,
and then NaCl was added. The resulting precipitate was collected, washed
with water, and dried to provide
1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-2H,7H-imidazo[4,5-g]quinazoline-2,8-di-one (4.73
g, 20.7 mmol) in 64% yield in two steps. Commercially available
4-hydroxyquinazoline (1.00 g, 6.85 mmol) was chlorinated with phosphorus
oxychloride (20 mL) by a known procedure. A mixture of
4-chloroquinazoline and anhydrous piperazine (5.89 g, 68.4 mmol) in
2-propanol (20 mL) was refluxed for 4 h. The reaction mixture was
evaporated, and the resulting residue was dissolved in brine, extracted
with chloroform, washed with brine, dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate,
and evaporated.
1,3-dihydro-1,3-dipropyl-2-oxo-8-(1-piperazinyl)-2H-imidazo[4,5-g]quinazoline.
quantitative yield.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(6):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: To an ice-cooled solution of
1,3-dihydro-6-nitro-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid methyl ester
(7.78 g, 32.8 mmol) in DMF (100 mL) was added 60% sodium hydride (3.94 g,
98.5 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 15 min at the same temperature,
and iodomethane (6.13 mL, 98.5 mmol) was added. Then the reaction mixture
was stirred for 1.5 h at room temperature and poured into water. The
resulting precipitate was collected, washed with water, and dried to
provide
1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-6-nitro-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester (8.58 g, 32.5 mmol) in 99% yield. (3) A suspension of
1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-6-nitro-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester (8.58 g, 32.4 mmol) and 10% Pd/C (1.60 g, containing 50%
water) in ethanol (100 mL) was hydrogenated for 5.5 h under hydrogen
stream at room temperature. After removal of catalyst by filtration
through Celite, the filtrate was evaporated to provide
6-amino-1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester. This compound was used for the next reaction without
further purification. (4) A solution of
6-amino-1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-2-oxo-2H-benzimidazole-5-carboxylic acid
methyl ester in forma- mide (100 mL) was heated for 2 h at 190°C. The
reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature and poured into water,
and then NaCl was added. The resulting precipitate was collected, washed
with water, and dried to provide
1,3-dihydro-1,3-dimethyl-2H,7H-imidazo[4,5-g]quinazoline-2,8-di-one (4.73
g, 20.7 mmol) in 64% yield in two steps. Commercially available
4-hydroxyquinazoline (1.00 g, 6.85 mmol) was chlorinated with phosphorus
oxychloride (20 mL) by a known procedure. A mixture of
4-chloroquinazoline and anhydrous piperazine (5.89 g, 68.4 mmol) in
2-propanol (20 mL) was refluxed for 4 h. The reaction mixture was
evaporated, and the resulting residue was dissolved in brine, extracted
with chloroform, washed with brine, dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate,
and evaporated.
1,3-dibutyl-1,3-dihydro-2-oxo-8-(1-piperazinyl)-2H-imidazo[4,5-g]quinazoline.
quantitative yield.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM Step B: To the formamide (6mL) solution of ethy2-amino-4-fluorobenzoate
(811mg, 4.43mmol) added ammonium formate (0.450g, 7.14mmol) and the
reaction mixture was heated at 140°C overnight. After cooling added water
and ethyl acetate. The layers were separated, the EtOAc layer was dried,
filtered and evaporated to give desired quinazolinone (quantitative).
Yield 1g. MS (ES) 165 (M+H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 1; Step 1; N-((3-hydroxyphenyl)(phenyl)methyl)formamide.
3-Hydroxybenzophenone (25 g, 126.1 mmol) in formamide (130 mL, 3.3 mmol)
was heated to 180°C for 18 hours. The reaction was allowed to cool
slightly then poured into ice-cooled water and stirred for 30 minutes,
filtered, and washed with water. The solid was stirred in water (60 mL)
and ethanol (60 mL) and heated to 50°C for 1 hour, then allowed to cool.
The solid was filtered and washed with water. Yield: (33.94 g, 118%). 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CD3OD): δ 7.39-7.28 (m, 5H); 7.21-7.13 (m, 1H); 6.79 (d, J
= 7.78 Hz, 1H); 6.73-6.68 (m, 2H); 5.45 (s, 1H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of heterocyclic-based compounds having muscarinic receptor
antagonist and beta2 adrenergic receptor agonist activity for treatment
of respiratory and inflammatory diseases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Rancati, Fabio; Rizzi, Andrea; Amari, Gabriele; Biagetti, Matteo; Linney,
Ian
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2012168359 A1 2012-12-13

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 28. Preparation of Intermediate C. Commercially available
5-amino-1H-pyrazole-4-carbonitrile (2.0 g, 18.5 mmol) was mixed with
formamide (10 mL) and heated to 180°C. overnight under nitrogen. The
solution was cooled to rt, 60 mL of water was added, and the resulting
precipitate was collected by vacuum filtration. Yield: (2.367 g, 95%). 1H
NMR (DMSO-d6, 300 MHz) δ 8.13 (s, 1H), 8.06 (s, 1H).

$DATUM Example 3:
N-(6-(4-amino-1-isopropyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-3-yl)benzo[d]thiazol-2-yl)acetamide.
Scheme 5: Synthesis of N-(6-(4-amino-1-isopropyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]
pyrimidin-3-yl)benzo[d]thiazol-2-yl)acetamide. A solution of 200 mL of
formamide and 3-amino-4-pyrazolecarbonitrile (101) (55 g, 0.509 mol) was
stirred at reflux for 1 h. The reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature and 800 mL of water was added. The resulting solid was
collected by filtration, rinsed with water and dried in vacuo to yield
the desired product, 1H- pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-4-amine (102) (64 g,
93% yield) as an off-white solid. ESI-MS (M+H)+ m/z :135.95.

$DATUM Process A, also described above under Preparation of the Compounds, was
used to prepare the following compound: Step A: A mixture of commercially
available S-amino-1H-pyrazole-4-carbonitrile (16.22 g, 0.15 mol) and
formamide (84.6 ml) was heated at 180°C for 4 hr under a nitrogen
atmosphere. The solution was cooled to ambient temperature and the
crystals were separated, washed with water and dried to afford the
product (18.6 g, 91 %).

$DATUM 540-69-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 5. Preparation of 7-bromornbenzothieno[2,3-d]pyrimidin-4(3H)-one
Ethyl 2-amino-6-bromo-1-benzothiophene-3-carboxylate (9.0 g, 27 mmol),
formamide (85 mL) and ammonium formate (2.7 g, 43 mmol) were heated in an
oil bath at 135 °C overnight. The next morning the reaction mixture was a
pastel blue slurry. The reaction mixture was allowed to cool to room
temperature and was then filtered. The solid was washed with water, dried
by filtration, and finally dried in a vacuum oven overnight at 45 °C to
yield a light blue solid (7.8 g, quantitative).
7-bromornbenzothieno[2,3-d]pyrimidin-4(3H)-one, yield (7.8 g,
quantitative). 1H NMR (DMSO-d6) δ 12.9 (br, 1H), 8.37 (s, 1H), 8.35 (d,
1H), 8.31 (s, 1H), 7.69 (d, 1H); LCMS RT = 3.08 min, [M+H]+ = 281.1.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Transamidation Reaction.
Amide (5.1 mmol) and amine (3.0 mmol) were dissolved or suspended in
toluene (3.0 mL), Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (61 mg, 0.15 mmol) was added, and the
mixture was refluxed until complete conversion (by TLC) of the amine. The
hot reaction mixture was filtered through a pad of Celite, concentrated,
and purified by flash chromatography as indicated below.
N-Benzylacetamide (7). The crude mixture was purified by flash
chromatography with DCM. Morpholine-4-carbaldehyde (13h). The crude
mixture was purified by flash chromatography with DCM/AcOEt (1:1). The
product was obtained as a yellow oil. Yield: 345 mg, quantitative. 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm) 8.07 (s, 1H), 3.64-3.72 (m, 4H), 3.58 (t, J = 9
Hz, 2H), 3.40 (t, J = 9 Hz, 2H). 13C{1H} NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm)
160.8, 67.2, 66.4, 45.8, 40.6. IR (ν, cm-1, KBr): 2979, 2924, 2863, 1655,
1442,1399, 1363, 1301, 1272, 1232, 1188, 1111, 1069, 1006, 855, 811. MS
(EI): 115 (99), 100 (74), 86 (46), 72 (33), 56 (92), 42 (100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Transamidation of Carboxamides Catalyzed by Fe(III) and Water
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Becerra-Figueroa, Liliana; Ojeda-Porras, Andrea; Gamba-Sanchez, Diego
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2014), 79(10), 4544-4552

$DATUM 4506-71-2

$DATUM 14346-24-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-368-CAS-5582931
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 100
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 5,6,7,8-Tetrahydrobenzo[4,5]thieno[2,3-d]pyrimidin-4-one (9)
Ethyl-2-amino-4,5,6,7-tetrahydrobenzothiophene-3-carboxylate (10.32 g,
45.86 mmol) was taken in formamide (44 mL) and heated to 170 °C Mass
temperature under a nitrogen atmosphere. The heating was continued until
the reaction was complete, and the progress of the reaction was monitored
by TLC. After 8 h, the reaction Mass was cooled to 10 °C, and solids were
thrown out. The solids were filtered, and the cake was washed with 50mL
of hexane. The product was sucked dry and finally dried in an oven at 50
°C. The yield being quantitative. % purity (HPLC)=98.85. The material was
utilized in the next step without any further purification. IR spectra
(cm-1): 3156, 3007, 2939, 2923, 1659, 1590, 1372, 990, 913, 580; mass
(m/z): 207.1 (M+H)+. Purified: IR (cm-1): 2939, 2857, 1659, 1590, 1372,
1170, 990, 913, 580; mass (m/z): 207.0 (M+H)+; 1H NMR (ppm): 1.86-1.88
(4H, m), 2.91-2.93 (4H, m), 8.75 (1H, s).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Convenient and efficient synthesis of some novel fused thieno pyrimidines
using Gewald's reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Anil K.; Dubey, P. K.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2011), 41(19), 2835-2851

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 6-Phenyl-3H-thieno[2,3-d]pyrimidin-4-one (8). Compound 7 (117 mmol) was
added to 170 °C hot formamide (225 ml) and the flask was equipped with a
distil. The mixture was heated at 190 °C for 2.5 h. The cooled mixture
was poured on water (200 ml). The precipitate was filtered off, washed
with water (200 ml) and dried. Yield: 27.0 g (100%). Grey solid,
6-Phenyl-3H-thieno[2,3-d]pyrimidin-4-one (8), yield 27.0 g (100%) mp
252-254 °C (EtOH), (lit. 263- 265 °C (CHCl3/MeOH), Arya et al. Indian J.
Chem. 1971, 9, 1209-1212).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Aldehydes under Barbier-Type Conditions

Bjerregaard

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 2-Hydroxy-3-formylaminobenzoic acid (49): Aniline 48 (0.51 g, 3.31 mmol)
was suspended in formamide (3.0 mL under N2) and the mixture stirred at
150° for 0.5 h. The resulting solution was allowed to cool, dissolved in
6% NaHCO3 (50 mL), acidified with 1 M KHSO4, and extracted with EtOAc (3
x 50 mL). The combined extract was washed with 5 M NaCl (10 mL), dried,
evaporated, and the residue coevaporated with toluene (10 mL) to furnish
90% of phenol 49 as a greenish gray solid. mp 168-169°; tlc Rf 0.20
(95:5:1 DCM- MeOH-HOAc); 1H NMR (d6-DMSO) δ 9.82 (1H, s), 8.38 (1H, d, J
= 9.3 Hz), 7.55 (1H, d, J = 7.7 Hz), 6.92 (1H, t, J = 7.7 Hz); 13C NMR
(d6-DMSO) δ 172.3, 160.3, 151.2, 126.5, 125.7, 124.5, 118.6, 112.6.

$DATUM Step 2d. 7-(Benzyloxy)-6-methoxyquinazolin-4(3H)-one (Compound 205). A
mixture of compound 204 (7.5 g, 25 mmol), ammonium formate (1.1 g, 22.4
mmol) and formamide (60 mL) was stirred and heated at 180~190 °C (oil
bath temperature) for 2 hours. Then the mixture was cooled to room
temperature and the resulting precipitate was isolated, washed with water
and dried to give the title compound 205 as a brown solid (6.5 g, 95%).
LCMS: 283 [M+1]+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Transamidation Reaction.
Amide (5.1 mmol) and amine (3.0 mmol) were dissolved or suspended in
toluene (3.0 mL), Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (61 mg, 0.15 mmol) was added, and the
mixture was refluxed until complete conversion (by TLC) of the amine. The
hot reaction mixture was filtered through a pad of Celite, concentrated,
and purified by flash chromatography as indicated below.
N-Benzylacetamide (7). The crude mixture was purified by flash
chromatography with DCM. Methyl Formylglycinate (13m). The crude mixture
was purified by flash chromatography with DCM/MeOH (9:1). The product was
obtained as a colorless oil. Yield: 351 mg, quantitative. 1H NMR (300
MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm) 7.28 (s, 1H), 4.11 (d, J = 5.3 Hz, 2H), 3.79 (s,
3H). 13C{1H} NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm) 170.0, 161.1, 52.5, 39.8. IR
(ν, cm-1, KBr): 3424, 2917, 2849, 1741, 1688, 1452, 1442, 1391, 1312,
1226, 1051. MS (EI) [M - CO]: 89 (22), 58 (65), 30 (100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Transamidation of Carboxamides Catalyzed by Fe(III) and Water
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Becerra-Figueroa, Liliana; Ojeda-Porras, Andrea; Gamba-Sanchez, Diego
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2014), 79(10), 4544-4552

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: A solution of 4 (20.2 g, 55.6 mmol) in
formamide (120 mL)was heated at 190°C for 5 h. The reaction mixture was
cooled to room temperature and poured into water. Then NaCl was added.
The resulting precipitate was collected, washed with water, and dried.
6-benzyloxy-7-methoxy-4(3H)-quinazolone (6) (19.4 g, 68.8 mmol) in
quantitative yield (5).

$DATUM 75-12-7
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 685-88-1
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 106615-61-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-368-CAS-10713702
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 100
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 124-41-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7647-01-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM To a three neck 5 L round bottom flask equipped with magnetic stirrer,
nitrogen flow and reflux condenser, was charged the following: sodium
methoxide (25% NaOMe in Methanol) (1.425 L, 6.230 mol) and formamide
(0.535 L, 13.5 mol) under nitrogen and heated to 64°C. To the reaction
mixture diethyl 2-fluoromalonate (CAS# 685-88-1, 0.266 L, 1.684 mol) was
added slowly using an addition funnel (reaction exothermic). The reaction
was heated at 64°C for 72 h. The reaction was cooled down to room
temperature and solvent was removed under reduced pressure. The residue
was cooled to 0°C by ice bath. The mixture was stirred and acidified
slowly with 10 N HCl to pH 1-2. The product precipitated out and was
filtered. The product was washed with ice cold 1N HCl. The off-white
solid was suspended in ACN, filtered and dried (vacuum oven) at 30°C for
16 h to give 5-fluoropyrimidine-4,6-diol. Light brown-pinkish solid,
yield 349.4 g, 2.686 mol, 160%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6) δ ppm 7.9 (s,
1H), 12.3 (brs, 2H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM alternative preparation shown, exothermic (stage 1)

GPR119 receptor for use in therapy

Marquez, Glen; Morgan, Michael E.; Sadeque, Abu J.M.

$DATUM Example 107A Step 4: A mixture of methyl
2-amino-5-(benzyloxy)-4-methoxybenzoate (7.36 g, 0.025 mol), formamide
(25 mL) and acetic acid (6.25 mL) was heated at 130°C for 24 hr. After
letting cooling down to room temperature, water was added and the
resulting solid was filtered and washed with plenty of cold water. The
solid was dried under vacuum at 120°C for 3 hr to yield
6-(benzyloxy)-7-methoxyquinazolin-4(3H)-one. Yield: 7.45 g (100%).
6-(benzyloxy)-7-methoxyquinazolin-4(3H)-one. Yield: 7.45 g 100%. 1H NMR
(DMSO-d6): δ 12.15 (1H, s), 8.05 (1H, s), 7.66 (1H, s), 7.44 (5H, m),
7.23 (1H, s), 5.28 (2H, s), 3.92 (3H, s). LC-MS (ESI) m/z 207 (M + H)+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 8e'. Ethyl
7-(7-methoxy-4-oxo-3,4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)heptanoate (Compound
0406-12). A mixture of compound 0405-12 (8.71 g, 23.7 mmol), ammonium
formate (1.48 g, 23.7 mmol) and formamide (40 mL) was stirred at 180°C
for 3 hours. After reaction the mixture was cooled to room temperature.
The formamide was removed under reduce pressure, and the residue was
dissolved in dichloromethane and washed with brine. The organic phase was
dried over sodium sulfate, filtered and concentrated to give the title
product 0406-12 as a pale white solid (8.18g, 99%). LCMS: 349 [M+1]+, 1H
NMR (DMSO-d6): δ 1.17 (t, J = 6.9 Hz, 3H), 1.38 (m, 4H), 1.55 (m, 2H),
1.75 (m, 2H), 2.29 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 3.90 (s, 3H), 4.05 (m, 4H), 7.13
(s, 1H), 7.42 (s, 1H), 7.97 (d, J = 3.6 Hz, 1H), 12.07 (s, 1H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Multi-functional small molecules as anti-proliferative agents and their
preparation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Cai, Xiong; Qian, Changgeng; Gould, Stephen; Zhai, Haixiao
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2008033747 A2 2008-03-20

$DATUM Ethyl 7-(7-methoxy-4-oxo-3, 4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)heptanoate (61).
A mixture of 59 (8.71 g, 23.7 mmol), ammonium formate (1.48 g, 23.7 mmol)
and formamide (40 mL) was stirred at 180 °C for 3 h. The mixture was
cooled to room temperature and the excess formamide was removed in vacuo.
The residue was dissolved in dichloromethane, and washed with water and
brine. The organic layer was dried over sodium sulfate, filtered, and
concentrated to give 61 as a pale white solid (8.18g, 99%). Ethyl
7-(7-methoxy-4-oxo-3, 4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)heptanoate (61), yield
8.18g, 99% 1H NMR (DMSO-d6): δ 1.17 (t, J = 6.9 Hz, 3H), 1.38 (m, 4H),
1.55 (m, 2H), 1.75 (m, 2H), 2.29 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 3.90 (s, 3H), 4.05
(m, 4H), 7.13 (s, 1H), 7.42 (s, 1H), 7.97 (d, J = 3.6 Hz, 1H), 12.07 (s,
1H). LCMS (ESI): m/z 349 [M + H]+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

7-(4-(3-Ethynylphenylamino)-7-methoxyquinazolin-6-yloxy)-N-hydroxyheptanamide
(CUDC-101) as a Potent Multi-Acting HDAC, EGFR, and HER2 Inhibitor for
the Treatment of Cancer

$DATUM Step 8e′. Ethyl 7-(7-methoxy-4-oxo-3,4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)
heptanoate (Compound 0406-12) A mixture of compound 0405-12 (8.71 g, 23.7
mmol), ammonium formate (1.48 g, 23.7 mmol) and formamide (40 mL) was
stirred at 180° C. for 3 hours. After reaction the mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The formamide was removed under reduce pressure, and
the residue was dissolved in dichloromethane and washed with brine. The
organic phase was dried over sodium sulfate, filtered and concentrated to
give the title product 0406-12 as a pale white solid (8.18 g, 99%): LCMS:
349 [M+1], 1H NMR (DMSO-d6): δ1.17 (t, J=6.9 Hz, 3H), 1.38 (m, 4H), 1.55
(m, 2H), 1.75 (m, 2H), 2.29 (t, J=7.2 Hz, 2H), 3.90 (s, 3H), 4.05 (m,
4H), 7.13 (s, 1H), 7.42 (s, 1H), 7.97 (d, J=3.6 Hz, 1H), 12.07 (s, 1H).

$DATUM Step 8e'. Ethyl 7-(7-methoxy-4-oxo-3, 4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)
heptanoate (Compound 0406-12) A mixture of compound 0405-12 (8.71 g, 23.7
mmol), ammonium formate (1.48 g, 23.7 mmol) and formamide (40 mL) was
stirred at 180 °C for 3 hours. After reaction the mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The formamide was removed under reduce pressure, and
the residue was dissolved in dichloromethane and washed with brine. The
organic phase was dried over sodium sulfate, filtered and concentrated to
give the title product 0406-12 as a pale white solid (8.18g, 99%) Ethyl
7-(7-methoxy-4-oxo-3, 4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy) heptanoate (Compound
0406-12), yield (8.18g, 99%): LCMS: 349 [M+1] + , 1H NMR (DMSO-d6): δ(t,
J= 6.9 Hz, 3H), 1.38 (m, 4H), 1.55 (m, 2H), 1.75 (m, 2H), 2.29 (t, J= 7.2
Hz, 2H), 3.90 (s, 3H), 4.05 (m, 4H), 7.13 (s, 1H), 7.42 (s, 1H), 7.97 (d,
J= 3.6 Hz, 1H), 12.07 (s, 1H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine
(3a) To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk-tube equipped with a stirbar was
added Pd2(dba)3 · CHCl3 (20.8 mg, 0.02 mmol),
2-Di-t-butylphosphino-3,4,5,6-tetramethyl-2',4',6'-tri-i-propylbiphenyl
(L1) (48 mg, 0.1 mmol), K3PO4 (639 mg, 3.01 mmol) and
2-Chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)pyridin-3-amine (2a) (500 mg, 2.01 mmol) (if
solid). The tube was evacuated and refilled with Ar(g). Formamide (0.12
mL, 3.01 mmol) was added via syringe as a single portion, followed by the
chloropyridine (if liquid) in 4 mL of tert-butanol. The reaction mixture
was degassed with 3 x vacuum / Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction vessel
was then equipped with a cold-finger under a positive pressure of argon
gas and immersed in a 110°C pre-heated oil-bath for 4h at which time TLC
showed consumption of the chloro-pyridine. The reaction was cooled to
room temperature, diluted with MeOH (4 mL) filtered through a Celite plug
and concentrated to give a dark brown oil. The crude product was purified
on a silica gel column (4.5 cm x 12 cm), eluting with 4% MeOH in CH2Cl2.
1-Butyl-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyrazine (12) Following the general
experimental; N-butyl-3-chloropyrazin-2-amine (6) (74 mg, 0.4 mmol),
Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol), t-BuBrettphos (9.7 mg, 0.02 mmol),
K3PO4 (128 mg, 0.6 mmol), formamide (0.022 mL, 0.6 mmol) were combined
with 2.0 mL tert-butanol in a 25 mL Schlenk flask. After 2 h the reaction
was complete, the reaction cooled to RT, filtered through Celite,
concentrated and purified on a silica gel column (2.5 cm x 12 cm),
eluting with 4% MeOH / CH2Cl2. 12 as 70 mg of a yellow solid (99%). 1H
NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.50 (d, J = 2.7 Hz, 1H), 8.32-8.30 (m, 2H),
4.29 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 1.90 (pent, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.35 (hex, J = 7.5
Hz, 2H), 0.93 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (75.4 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 146.1,
147.0, 140.1, 140.0, 138.6, 44.2, 31.9, 20.0, 13.6; FT-IR (NaCl, thin
film) ν = 3412, 3096, 2057, 2960, 2874, 1655, 1570, 1486, 1464, 1402,
1351, 1196, 850, 757, 638 cm-1. HRMS (ESI) Calc (C9H12N4)H+: 177.1135,
Found: 177.1142; MP: 84-86°C; Rf (4% MeOH / CH2Cl2): 0.23.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM thermal, Schlenk tube used

$DATUM Ethyl 7-(7-(D3-methoxy)-4-oxo-3,4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy) heptanoate
(6). A mixture of 5 (0.3 g, 0.81 mmol), ammonium formate 1.0 equivalent
and formamide (2 mL) was stirred at 180 °C for 3 h. The mixture was
cooled to room temperature and the excess formamide was removed in vacuo.
The residue was dissolved in dichloromethane, and washed with water and
brine. The organic layer was dried over sodium sulfate, filtered, and
concentrated to give 6. Yield 0.28 g, 99%, pale yellow solid. HPLC-MS
(ESI): m/z 352 [M + H]+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 75-12-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Procedure for the Preparation of 7-Bromo-4-chlorothieno[ 3,2-d]pyrimidine
(4). 3-Aminothiophene-2-carboxamide (1) (1.42 g, 10.0 mmol) was dissolved
in formamide (5 mL). The resulting solution was heated at 180 °C for 5 h,
and then it was allowed to stand at room temperature for 2 h. The
precipitate that formed was collected by vacuum filtration to give
3H-thieno[3, 2-d]pyrimidin-4-one (2) (1.52 g, 99% yield) as a white
solid.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of a 7-Arylthieno[3,2-d]pyrimidin-4-Amine Library
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Peng, Jinsong; Lin, Wenqing; Jiang, Dahong; Yuan, Shixue; Chen, Yuanwei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Combinatorial Chemistry (2007), 9(3), 431-436

$DATUM Step 9a. 6-Hydroxyquinazolin-4(3H)-one (compound 0202) To a solution of
2-amino-5-hydroxybenzoic acid 0201 (30.6 g, 0.2 mol) in formamide was
stirred and heated to 190° C. for 0.5 h. The mixture was allowed to cool
to room temperature. The precipitate was isolated, washed with ether and
dried to obtain title compound 0202 (32 g, brown solid, yield: 99%):
LC-MS m/z 163 [M+1]; 1H NMR (DMSO-d6): δ7.25 (dd, 1H), 7.40 (d, 1H), 7.46
(d, 1H), 7.88 (s, 1H)

$DATUM Example 9: Preparation of
2-(4-(3-chloro-4-fluorophenylamino)quinazolin-6-yloxy)-N-hydroxyacetamide
(Compound 13). Step 9a. 6-hydroxyquinazolin-4(3H)-one (compound 0202). To
a solution of 2-amino-5-hydroxybenzoic acid 0201 (30.6 g, 0.2 mol) in
formamide was stirred and heated to 190°C for 0.5 h. The mixture was
allowed to cool to room temperature. The precipitate was isolated, washed
with ether and dried to obtain title compound 0202 (32g, brown solid,
yield: 99%). LC-MS m/z 163 [M+1]; 1H NMR (DMSO) δ 7.25 (dd, 1H), 7.40 (d,
1H), 7.46 (d, 1H), 7.88 (s, 1H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Adducts 2a,c,d,f,h-j; General Procedure An aqueous solution of
formaldehyde (37% w/w, 1 equiv) was added to a mixture of the appropriate
amide (1 equiv) and either solid K2CO3 (0.1 equiv; 2a,c,j) or aq 1 N NaOH
(0.01 equiv, 2d,f,h,i). The mixture was stirred at r.t. for 2 h. The H2O
formed was removed in vacuo. The residue was diluted with CHCl3, EtOAc,
or MeOH (1 mL/mmol), dried (MgSO4), and filtered. After removal of the
solvent, the adduct was obtained and used for the next step without
further purification. N-Hydroxymethylformamide (2a)3 From formamide 1a
(3.6 g, 80 mmol); yield: 5.96 g (99%); colorless oil. IR (ATR): 3290,
2962, 1657, 1532, 1386, 1233, 1016, 875, 697, 648, 605 cm-1. 1H NMR (400
MHz, CDCl3): δ = 3.27 (br s, 1 H), 4.67 (s, 1 H), 4.79 (m, 2 H), 8.18 (s,
1 H). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 63.8, 164.2. HRMS (EI): m/z [M]+
calcd for C2H5NO2: 75.0320; found: 75.0316.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 835632-29-6

$DATUM 835632-30-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-368-CAS-5193254
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-12-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 2. Preparation of Example 14: Ethyl
4-oxo-3,4,5,6,7,8-hexahydro[1]benzothieno[2,3-d]pyrimidine-7-carboxylate
In a 100 mL round-bottom flask was placed 3.5 g (11.75 mmol, 1 equiv) of
2-amino-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-benzo[b]thiophene-3,6-dicarboxylic acid
diethyl ester in 10 mL of formamide. The flask was equipped with a reflux
condenser and heated at 140 °C for 16 h. The mixture was then allowed to
cool to rt and a brown solid precipitated from solution. The resulting
precipitate was filtered and rinsed with EtOAc (200 mL) and dried in a
hi-vac oven for 2 h. After drying 3.25 g (99%) of the desired product as
a brown solid was obtained and used without further purification in the
next step. LCMS RT = 2.80 min; [M+H]+ = 279.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of substituted tetrahydrobenzothienopyrimidinamines for
treating hyper-proliferative disorders
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhang, Chengzhi; Ladouceur, Gaetan H.; Brennan, Catherine; Chandler,
Brent; Dixon, Julie A.; Miranda, Karl; Fan, Dongping; Zhu, Qingming;
Verma, Sharad K.; Dumas, Jacques
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2005010008 A1 2005-02-03

$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 9,10-Bis(formamido)anthracene (7) 2 A mixture of anthraquinone (10.0 g,
0.048 mol) and formamide (90 ml, 2.33 mol) was refluxed for 12 h. During
that time, the solid initially present dissolved, then a second material
began to separate, yielding eventually a thick slurry. When the reaction
was complete, it was cooled and filtered. The straw-yellow solid was
washed with water, and then repeatedly with methanol and dried. The
obtained brown-yellow solid was vigorously washed with aniline, and then
filtered. To remove aniline, the precipitate was washed with chloroform.
Obtained 9,10-bis(formamido)anthracene was straw-yellow solid (12.7 g).
Yield ≥99%. FT-IR (KBr) : 3207, 1651, 1539, 1515, 1398 cm-1. Any other
peak was not observed in carbonyl region (1600-1900 cm-1).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly Twisted N,N-Dialkylamines as a Design Strategy to Tune Simple
Aromatic Hydrocarbons as Steric Environment-Sensitive Fluorophores
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sasaki, Shunsuke; Suzuki, Satoshi; Sameera, W. M. C.; Igawa, Kazunobu;
Morokuma, Keiji; Konishi, Gen-ichi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2016), 138(26), 8194-8206

$DATUM Step 20e. Ethyl
7-(7-(2-methoxyethoxy)-4-oxo-3,4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)heptanoate
(Compound 0406-30) A mixture of compound 0405-30 (315.0 mg, 0.76 mmol),
ammonium formate (48.0 mg, 0.76 mmol) and formamide (2.46 mL) was stirred
at 190° C. for 3 hours. The reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The formamide was removed under reduce pressure, and the
residue was dissolved in ethyl acetate (30 mL). The organic layer was
washed with brine (10 mL×5) and dried over sodium sulfate, filtered and
evaporated to give the title product 0406-30 as a white solid (235 mg,
98%): LCMS: 393 [M+1]+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 98
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 540-69-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 20e. Ethyl
7-(7-(2-methoxyethoxy)-4-oxo-3,4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)heptanoate
(Compound 0406-30). A mixture of compound 0405-30 (315.0 mg, 0.76 mmol),
ammonium formate (48.0 mg, 0.76 mmol) and formamide (2.46 mL) was stirred
at 190°C for 3 hours. The reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The formamide was removed under reduce pressure, and the
residue was dissolved in ethyl acetate (30 mL). The organic layer was
washed with brine (10 mL×5) and dried over sodium sulfate, filtered and
evaporated to give the title product 0406-30 as a white solid (235 mg,
98%). LCMS: 393 [M+1]+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Transamidation Reaction.
Amide (5.1 mmol) and amine (3.0 mmol) were dissolved or suspended in
toluene (3.0 mL), Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (61 mg, 0.15 mmol) was added, and the
mixture was refluxed until complete conversion (by TLC) of the amine. The
hot reaction mixture was filtered through a pad of Celite, concentrated,
and purified by flash chromatography as indicated below.
N-Benzylacetamide (7). The crude mixture was purified by flash
chromatography with DCM. N-Formyl-(S)-phenylalanine Methyl Ester (13l).
The crude mixture was purified by flash chromatography with DCM/MeOH
(9:1). The product was obtained as a viscous oil. Yield: 590 mg, 95%. 1H
NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm) 8.17 (s, 1H), 7.09- 7.33(m, 5H), 6.11 (s,
1H), 4.94-5.01 (m, 1H), 3.75 (s, 3H), 3.16 (t, J = 5.9 Hz, 2H). 13C NMR
(75 MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm) 172.0, 161.3, 136.0, 129.8, 129.2, 127.8, 53.0,
52.3, 38.3. IR (ν, cm-1, KBr): 3301, 3030, 2953, 2960, 2870, 1744, 1668,
1543. MS (EI) [M - NHCOH]: 162 (17), 91 (20), 44 (18). [α]D 18 = 89.14 (c
= 1.1).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 75-09-2

$DATUM 7664-41-7

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 1: 300 g (1.83 mol) of 1,3-dimethyladamantane (1,3-DMA) and 900
ml of sulfuric acid 96% (16.2 mol) are mixed and cooled to 0°C to 5°C.
This solution is concurrently added together with 180 ml of formam ide
(4.53 mol) into a vessel precharged with sulfuric acid 96% (150 ml)
preheated to 55-60°C, over the time period of two hours, keeping the
internal temperature at T = 55°C-60°C. After completion of the
formylation, the mixture is cooled to 5°C and quenched into a cold
solution (0°C), containing water (720 ml), aqueous ammonia 30% (480 ml)
and dichloromethane (900 ml), while keeping the temperature below 25°C.
The aqueous acidic layer is re-extracted with 450 ml of dichloromethane.
The combined organic layers are washed three times with 600 ml water.
With the last washing the pH is corrected to 8 to 9 using aqueous
ammonia. N-Formyl-1-amino-3,5-dimethyladamantane is obtained as a
solution in dichloromethane, which can be used in the subsequent step.
Solvent removal gives 360 g of N-Formyl-1-amino-3,5-dimethyladamantane
(NFORM) (yield 95%). The purity as measured by GC is 98%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Process for the manufacture of memantine and intermediate product
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Huber, Florian Anton Martin; Gallo, Giorgio; De Faveri, Carla
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2009115334 A2 2009-09-24

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM N-(3,5-Dimethyl-adamantan-1-yl)formamide (8). A mixture of
1-chloro-3,5-dimethyl-adamantane (7, 100.0 g, 0.50 mol) and formamide
(500.0 mL) was heated to 150 °C for 8 h, to which was added ice-cold
water; the reaction mass was extracted with methylene chloride (70.0 mL),
the separated organic layer was concentrated, and a white solid was
isolated and dried under vacuum: yield 101 g (98%), GC purity 99.85%. 1H
NMR: δ 8.2 (d, 1H), 7.8 (s, 1H), 2.15 (m, 1H), 1.68 (m, 2H), 1.45 (s,
4H), 1.2-1.3 (m, 6H), 0.80 (s, 6H); IR: 3347 cm-1 (NH), 1690 cm-1 (C=O);
MS: 208 (M + 1); Anal. calcd for C13H21NO: C 75.32, H 10.21, N 6.76.
Found: C 75.16, H 10.16, N 6.86.

$DATUM 75-65-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine
(3a) To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk-tube equipped with a stirbar was
added Pd2(dba)3 · CHCl3 (20.8 mg, 0.02 mmol),
2-Di-t-butylphosphino-3,4,5,6-tetramethyl-2',4',6'-tri-i-propylbiphenyl
(L1) (48 mg, 0.1 mmol), K3PO4 (639 mg, 3.01 mmol) and
2-Chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)pyridin-3-amine (2a) (500 mg, 2.01 mmol) (if
solid). The tube was evacuated and refilled with Ar(g). Formamide (0.12
mL, 3.01 mmol) was added via syringe as a single portion, followed by the
chloropyridine (if liquid) in 4 mL of tert-butanol. The reaction mixture
was degassed with 3 x vacuum / Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction vessel
was then equipped with a cold-finger under a positive pressure of argon
gas and immersed in a 110°C pre-heated oil-bath for 4h at which time TLC
showed consumption of the chloro-pyridine. The reaction was cooled to
room temperature, diluted with MeOH (4 mL) filtered through a Celite plug
and concentrated to give a dark brown oil. The crude product was purified
on a silica gel column (4.5 cm x 12 cm), eluting with 4% MeOH in CH2Cl2.
1-Phenyl-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine (3o) Following the general
experimental; 2-chloro-N-(phenyl)pyridin-3-amine (2o) (82 mg, 0.36 mmol),
Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol), L1 (9.6 mg, 0.02 mmol), K3PO4 (128
mg, 0.6 mmol), formamide (0.022 mL, 0.6 mmol) were combined with 2 mL
tert-butanol in a 25 mL Schlenk flask. After 4 h the reaction was
complete, the reaction cooled to RT, filtered through Celite,
concentrated and purified on a silica gel column (2.5 cm x 12 cm),
eluting with 4% MeOH / CH2Cl2. 3o as 76.5 mg of a white solid (98%). 1H
NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.65 (d, J = 4.5 Hz, 1H), 8.37 (s, 1H), 7.89
(dd, J = 8.1 Hz, 1.2 Hz, 1H), 7.65-7.57 (m, 2H), 7.55-7.47 (m, 3H), 7.30
(dd, J = 8.4 Hz, 4.8 Hz, 1H); 13C NMR (75.4 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 145.6, 145.6,
144.5, 135.8, 130.5, 128.8, 126.3, 124.0, 119.1, 119.0; FT-IR (NaCl, thin
film) ν = 3124, 1597, 1502, 1477, 1412, 1301, 1194, 785 cm-1. HRMS (ESI)
Calc (C12H9N3): 195.0796, Found: 195.0794; MP: 120-124°C; Rf (4% MeOH /
CH2Cl2): 0.24.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM thermal, Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 2,6-Naphthalenedicarboxamide (CAS #46711-49-3) was prepared as follows.
To a two liter three neck round-bottom flask fitted with a mechanical
stirrer, addition funnel and condenser/ Dean Stark apparatus, with a
nitrogen inlet was charged 85.4 grams (0.35 mol) dimethyl
2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylate, 105.3 grams (2.34 mol) formamide, and 200
mls of anhydrous N,N-dimethylformamide. The flask contents were heated to
100 degrees C. under a nitrogen atmosphere and held for one hour. One
hundred ml of a 25 wt. % solution of sodium methoxide in methanol was
added through the addition funnel in four approximately equal portions.
The flask contents were then heated for four hours at 100 degrees C.
during which time methanol was being condensed and removed. The flask was
cooled to room temperature and one liter of isopropyl alcohol was added
in two 500 ml increments. After the resulting mixture was stirred for 15
minutes it was allowed to settle for one hour. Crystallized solid
material was collected by filtration and air dried in the filter for 2
hours. The recovered off-white colored product weighed 112.7 grams. The
solid was washed three times in deionized water and twice in methanol.
71.4 grams of greater than 98% pure product. Melting point: 347-349
degrees C.; 1H NMR: This compound is insoluble in all common NMR solvents
and only sparingly soluble in DMSO-d6. (DMSO-d6) δ 8.53 ppm (broad s),
8.21 ppm (broad s), 8.07 ppm (complex multi. from 8.09−8.00 ppm), 7.55
ppm (broad s), also 3.38 ppm (water), and 2.51 (DMSO); MS m/z 214 [M].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Dean-Stark apparatus used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Polyesters with low molecular weight additives for improved gas barrier
properties
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Peters, Richard Dalton; Cliffton, Michael Duane
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM United States, US20120199515 A1 2012-08-09

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Example 6: Preparation of 4-amino
furopyrimidine-based compound
4-amino-6-(4-chlorophenyl)furo[2,3,d]Pyrimidine(Vla) 20ml of formamide
was applied dropwisely to the 4.37 g (20 mmol) of 2-
amino-3-cyano-5-(4-chlorophenyl)furan (IVa) obtained in Example 5, which
was heated and refluxed for 12 hours and then cooled at a room
temperature. 100 ml of water was added thereto, and a generated solid was
filtered, which was washed with water and n-hexane sufficiently, and
then, dried. Thereafter, the resultant material was re-crystallized with
acetone and ethylalcohol to obtain a brown-colored solid product of
4-amino-6-(4-chlorophenyl)furo[2,3,d]pyrimidine (VIa). Compounds Vlb to
VIy of table 4 were also obtained, respectively, according to the same
method. [Table 4] VIv, yield 98% Table 4 shows analysis results of the
obtained 4-amino furopyrimidine based compound VIa to VIy 1H NMR (400 MHz
DMSO-d6) δ (ppm) : 8.27 (s, 1H), 7.62 (d, J= 8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.51 (d, J= 8.4
Hz, 2H), 7.46 (d, J= 8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.39 (d. J= 8.4 Hz, 2H)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of furo[2,3-d]pyrimidines as inhibitors of DDR2 (discoidin
domain receptor 2) tyrosine kinase.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 2: 1-isobutyl-1H-imidazo [4,5-c] quinolin-4-amine Potassium
tert-butoxide (2.16 g, 0.019 mole), 4.5 mL of dimethylsulfoxide and 0.76
mL (0.019 mole) of formamide were added in a 50-mL round-bottomed flask,
under inert atmosphere followed by stirring for 30 minutes. After
addition of 4-chloro-1H-imidazo [4,5-c] quinoline (1g, 3.8 mmoles), the
mixture was heated at 105°C, followed by stirring for 2 hours and then
cooled to room temperature.Then 10 mL of water and 6N HCl were
sequentially added until pH 8. The reaction mixture was filtered followed
by washing with abundant water and dried to give 0.91 g of
1-isobutyl-1H-imidazo [4, 5-c] quinolin-4-amine. Yield 98%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM yield and product distribution depends on solvent, temperature
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Base-hydrolysis method for making
1-substituted-1H-imidazo[4,5-c]quinolin-4-amines from their corresponding
4-aminoformyl derivatives
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION

$DATUM 10043-35-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure. A mixture of amide (10
mmol), amine (10 mmol), water (180-360 mg, 10-20 mmol) and boric acid (62
mg, 1 mmol) was stirred in a pressure equalization tubes at indicated
temperature for indicated reaction time (See Tables 1-4). After being
cooled to room temperature, the crude reaction mixture was purified by
recrystallization or silica gel column chromatography (dissolved in
dichloromethane, eluted with dichloromethane and ethyl acetate or
methanol). N-(4-Chlorophenyl)formamide15 (4g). Purification of the crude
mixture by recrystallization (CH2Cl2/heptanes 1/1) afforded the product
as grey powder, yield 92%.The presence of two rotamers (ratio 5:1) was
observed in the NMR spectra. 1H NMR (500 MHz, DMSO-d6) δ 10.37 (M) (broad
s, 1H), 8.79 (m) (s, 1H), 8.29 (M) (s, 1H), 8.60 (m) (d, J=11.2 Hz, 1H),
7.62 (M) (d, J=8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.36 (d, J=8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.22 (m) (d, J=8.3
Hz, 2H). 13C NMR (125 MHz, DMSO-d6) δ 163.0 (m), 160.2 (M), 137.9 (m),
137.7 (M), 129.7 (m), 129.2 (M), 127.9 (m), 120.2 (m), 127.6 (M), 121.2
(M), 119.4 (m).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry-catalyst, pressure tube used, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Boric Acid: A Highly Efficient Catalyst for Transamidation of
Carboxamides with Amines
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine
(3a) To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk-tube equipped with a stirbar was
added Pd2(dba)3 · CHCl3 (20.8 mg, 0.02 mmol),
2-Di-t-butylphosphino-3,4,5,6-tetramethyl-2',4',6'-tri-i-propylbiphenyl
(L1) (48 mg, 0.1 mmol), K3PO4 (639 mg, 3.01 mmol) and
2-Chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)pyridin-3-amine (2a) (500 mg, 2.01 mmol) (if
solid). The tube was evacuated and refilled with Ar(g). Formamide (0.12
mL, 3.01 mmol) was added via syringe as a single portion, followed by the
chloropyridine (if liquid) in 4 mL of tert-butanol. The reaction mixture
was degassed with 3 x vacuum / Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction vessel
was then equipped with a cold-finger under a positive pressure of argon
gas and immersed in a 110°C pre-heated oil-bath for 4h at which time TLC
showed consumption of the chloro-pyridine. The reaction was cooled to
room temperature, diluted with MeOH (4 mL) filtered through a Celite plug
and concentrated to give a dark brown oil. The crude product was purified
on a silica gel column (4.5 cm x 12 cm), eluting with 4% MeOH in CH2Cl2.
1-Methyl-5-phenyl-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine (11) Following the general
experimental; 2-chloro-N-methyl-6-phenylpyridin-3-amine (5) (87.5 mg, 0.4
mmol), Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol), L1 (9.6 mg, 0.02 mmol),
K3PO4 (128 mg, 0.6 mmol), formamide (0.022 mL, 0.6 mmol) were combined
with 2.0 mL tert-butanol in a 25 mL Schlenk flask. After 3 h the reaction
was complete, the reaction cooled to RT, filtered through Celite,
concentrated and purified on a silica gel column (2.5 cm x 12 cm),
eluting with 4% MeOH / CH2Cl2. 11 as 81 mg of a pale brown solid (89%).
1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.13-8.08 (m, 2H), 7.99 (s, 1H), 7.67 (1/2 AB
d, J = 8.4 Hz, 1H), 7.64 (1/2 AB d, J = 8.4 Hz, 1H), 7.49-7.41 (m, 2H),
7.40-7.33 (m, 1H), 3.78 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (75.4 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 156.4,
152.9, 146.1, 139.8, 128.7, 128.5, 127.2, 125.8, 118.2, 115.6, 31.5;
FT-IR (NaCl, thin film) ν = 2920, 2852, 1613, 1574, 1495, 1461, 1436,
1407, 1345, 1293, 1199, 1051, 762 cm-1. Anal. Calc C13H11N3: C, 74.62; H,
5.30; N, 20.08; found C, 74.95; H, 5.49; N, 20.37; Rf (4% MeOH / CH2Cl2):
0.23; MP: 157-160°C.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM thermal, Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
3-(4-Methoxylphenyl)-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine (32), yield
97%. Mp 175-176 °C (hexane-EtOAc). 1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 3.87 (3H,
s), 7.08-7.84 (2H, m), 7.32-7.36 (1H, m), 7.50-7.56 (2H, m), 7.95- 8.01
(2H, m), 8.28-8.32 (2H, m), 9.10 (1H, s), 9.45 (1H, s). 13C NMR (125 MHz,
CDCl3): δ 55.4 (CH3), 114.2, 114.6 (2 × C), 121.3 (2 × C), 124.1, 126.7,
128.7 (2 × C), 129.2 (2 × C), 138.6, 144.8, 152.8, 153.2, 155.5, 160.8.
IR (KBr): 3047, 2924, 1612, 1582, 1503, 1431, 1356, 1254, 1219, 1092
cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 302 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C18H14N4O: C,
71.51; H, 4.67; N, 18.53. Found: C, 71.48; H, 4.68; N, 18.50.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Three-Component Heterocyclization

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 6,7-Dimethoxy-4-quinazolone (9). To a solution of 8 (200 g) in DMF (1.6
L) and methanol (400 mL), formamide (180 g) and sodium methoxide (146 g)
were added. The reaction mixture was stirred for 10 h under reflux
conditions. After quench by cold water, the mixture was neutralized by 1
N hydrochloride solution. Precipitated solid was collected by filtration
and washed with water, ethyl acetate, and hexane to give 9 (190 g, yield
97%). 6,7-Dimethoxy-4-quinazolone (9), Yield (190 g, 97%)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Identification of Potent and Selective Inhibitors of PDGF Receptor
Autophosphorylation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Furuta, Takayuki; Sakai, Teruyuki; Senga, Terufumi; Osawa, Tatsushi;
Kubo, Kazuo; Shimizu, Toshiyuki; Suzuki, Rika; Yoshino, Tetsuya; Endo,
Megumi; Miwa, Atsushi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Medicinal Chemistry (2006), 49(7), 2186-2192

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
N,N′-Diarylformamidines (50-56 and 73). The reliable procedure involved
the treatment of arylamines (43-49; 1.0 equiv) or 3-aminopyridine (68;
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60
°C over 0.5-1.0 h. When the reaction was complete, the crude solid was
triturated in cold n-pentane and filtered through a glass frit with
suction. Then the solid was washed with n-pentane and dried in vacuo to
give the crude formamidines (50-56 and 73). The crude products were
recrystallized from the mixture of acetone and diisopropyl ether to give
the corresponding N,N′-diarylformamidine products (50-56 and 73) in
88-97% yields as white to light yellow solids.
N,N'-Bis(4-fluorophenyl)formamidine (56).35 The standard procedure
involved the treatment of 4-fluoroaniline (49; 49 mg, 0.51 mmol, 1.0
equiv) with PBr3 (0.14 mL, 1.5 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2
mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
56: 97% yield (115 mg), yellow solid. Mp 142-144 °C (CH2Cl2-methanol). 1H
NMR (CDCl3, 200 MHz): δ 7.09-6.96 (8H, m), 8.02 (1H, s), 9.61 (1H, s).
13C NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3): δ 161.8, 1573.0, 150.2, 141.2, 120.5, 120.4,
116.2, 115.8. IR (KBr): 3428, 2928, 2862, 1671, 1603, 1502, 1380, 1313,
1202 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 236 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C13H10F2N2:
C, 67.24; H, 4.32; N, 12.06. Found: C, 67.23; H, 4.34; N, 12.07.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM (1) 6-Iodo-quinazolin-4-ol. A solution of 2-amino-5-iodo-benzoic acid
(5.0 g, 19.0 mmol) in formamide (21.6 g, 479 mmol) was heated at 160
degree for 3 hours. Water (50 mL) was added to form the black fine solid.
The mixture was stirred for 16 hour, then filtered to collect the solid.
The dark brown solid was then dried in vacuum oven for overnight at 60
degree to give the intermediate title compound. Yield: (4.83 g, 94%). m/z
273.0 [M+1].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM synthesis of 6-bromo-4-hydroxy-quinazoline. A suspension of
2-amino-5-bromobenzoic acid (5.4 g, 25 mmol) in formamide (40ml) was
heated at 165°C for 6 hours. After cooling to room temperature, water
(100ml) was added to the reaction mixture. The precipitate was collected
by filtration, washed with water and dried over P2O5, yielding the title
compound as a white solid (5.3 g, yield: 95%) which was characterized by
its mass spectrum as follows:. MS (m/z): 225 ([M+H]+, 100)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

treating viral infection and their preparation

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 2 -synthesis of 6-bromo-4-hydroxy-guinazoline A suspension of
2-amino-5-bromobenzoic acid (5.4 g, 25 mmol) in formamide (40 ml) was
heated at 165 C for 6 hours. After cooling to room temperature, water
(100 ml) was added to the reaction mixture. The precipitate was collected
by filtration, washed with water and dried over P2O5, yielding the title
compound as a white solid (5.3 g, yield: 95 %) which was characterized by
its mass spectrum as follows: MS (m/z): 225 ([M+H]+, 100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 46A 7-nitroquniazolin-4(3H)-one A mixture of 4-nitroanthranilic acid
(2.07 g, 11.4 mmol) and formamide (2 mL, 50 mmol) was heated to 200 °C
(oil bath temperature) with stirring for 1.5 h. Water (4 mL) was added to
the cooled reaction mixture. The resulting slurry was filtered and washed
with ethanol (3X) to afford 46A. Brown crystals, yield 2.048 g, 94%.
LC-MS: 192.2 (M + H)+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM To the material from step 1 (5.0 gm, 27 mmol) was added formamide (16 mL,
405 mmol) at rt under argon followed by ammonium formate (3.41 gm, 54
mmol). The resulting solution was warmed to 150-155°C and stirred over
night. After cooling to rt, the mostly solidified reaction mixture was
transferred to a cold brine solution and swirled vigorously for 15
minutes. The off-white solid was filtered, air dried for an hour, and
then stored under high vacuum over night to afford the desired product.
Yield 96%. ES-MS: (M+H)+ 167.

$DATUM A suspension of 5-amino-1-( β-hydroxyethyl)-4-pyrazolecarbonitrile26 10
(1.52 g, 10 mmol) in 3 mL of formamide was vigorously boiled under
stirring for 2 h. The cooled solution was then diluted with ice-water,
and the solid separated was filtrated, washed with water, and
recrystallized. Yield 96%. m.p = 217-219 °C (Lett. mp 223-224 °C).

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: A suspension of 5-amino-1-(
β-hydroxyethyl)-4-pyrazolecarbonitrile26 10 (1.52 g, 10 mmol) in 3 mL of
formamide was vigorously boiled under stirring for 2 h. The cooled
solution was then diluted with ice-water, and the solid separated was
filtrated, washed with water, and recrystallized. Yield 96%.
4-Amino-1-(β-hydroxyethyl)pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine. m.p = 217-219 °C
(Lett. mp 223-224 °C).

$DATUM 7789-60-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-12-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
1-(3-Chlorophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine (21). The
standard procedure involved the treatment of
5-amino-1-(3-chlorophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole (5; 101 mg, 0.33 mmol,
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (0.09 mL, 0.99 mmol, 3 equiv) in formamide solution
(2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
21: 96% yield (97 mg), yellow solid. Mp 188- 189 °C (hexane-EtOAc). 1H
NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 7.27-7.33 (1H, m), 7.43-7.48 (1H, m), 7.48-7.52
(1H, m), 7.53-7.59 (2H, m), 8.01-8.07 (2H, m), 8.32-8.36 (1H, m),
8.42-8.44 (1H, m), 9.14 (1H, s), 9.50 (1H, s). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3):
δ 114.5, 118.9, 121.1, 126.6, 127.4 (2 × C), 129.3 (2 × C), 129.9, 130.2,
131.2, 135.0, 139.6, 145.4, 152.9, 153.6, 155.8. IR (KBr): 3099, 3062,
2922, 2851, 1585, 1491, 1406, 1215 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 306 (100,
M+). Anal. Calcd for C17H11ClN4: C, 66.56; H, 3.61; N, 18.26. Found: C,
66.58; H, 3.62; N, 18.29.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sequential three-component heterocyclization, one-pot multi-component
process
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Evaluation of Electrophilic Heteroaromatic Substitution: Synthesis of
Heteroaromatic-Fused Pyrimidine Derivatives via Sequential
Three-Component Heterocyclization
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Wong, Fung Fuh; Huang, Yu-Ying; Chang, Chun-Hsi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2012), 77(19), 8492-8500

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 96
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Example 6: Preparation of 4-amino
furopyrimidine-based compound
4-amino-6-(4-chlorophenyl)furo[2,3,d]Pyrimidine(Vla) 20ml of formamide
was applied dropwisely to the 4.37 g (20 mmol) of 2-
amino-3-cyano-5-(4-chlorophenyl)furan (IVa) obtained in Example 5, which
was heated and refluxed for 12 hours and then cooled at a room
temperature. 100 ml of water was added thereto, and a generated solid was
filtered, which was washed with water and n-hexane sufficiently, and
then, dried. Thereafter, the resultant material was re-crystallized with
acetone and ethylalcohol to obtain a brown-colored solid product of
4-amino-6-(4-chlorophenyl)furo[2,3,d]pyrimidine (VIa). Compounds Vlb to
VIy of table 4 were also obtained, respectively, according to the same
method. [Table 4] VIj, yield 96% Table 4 shows analysis results of the
obtained 4-amino furopyrimidine based compound VIa to VIy 1H NMR (400 MHz
DMSO-d6) δ (ppm) : 8.15 (s, 1H), 7.72 (d, J= 8.8 Hz, 2H), 7.60 (d, J= 8.8
Hz, 1H), 7.48-7.40 (m, 1H), 7.26-7.02 (m, 7H), 2.51 (s, 3H)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General procedure for CuI-catalyzed formation of
3-substituted-4-quinazolines and 2,3-disubstituted-4(3H )-quinazolines
from 2-bromo-N-phenylbenzamide. For 3-substituted-4-quinazoline
(11a-11r). A Schlenk tube was charged with N-substituted 2-bromobenzamide
(0.25 mmol), CuI (5 mg, 0.025 mmol), trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline (3 mg,
0.025 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (163 mg, 0.5 mmol). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with argon before formamide (20 µL, 0.5 mmol) and 1 mL DMF was
added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 80 o C (or 90 o C for
substrate 7l) for 24 h. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, 5 mL of saturated NH4Cl solution was added. The mixture was
extracted with EtOAc and the organic layer was washed with water, brine
and dried over Na2SO4. After concentration in vacuo, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel. The desired
3-substituted 4-quinazoline. 3-Phenylquinazolin-4(3H)-one (11a). 1 53 mg,
95% yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.38 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 1H), 8.14 (s,
1H), 7.83-7.76 (m, 2H), 7.57-7.42 (m, 6H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ
160.85, 147.97, 146.19, 137.59, 134.68, 129.74 (2C), 129.21, 127.75,
127.69, 127.27, 127.11 (2C), 122.48; HRMS-ESI: m/z calcd for C14H11N2O [M
+ H]+: 223.0871, found 223.0860.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM optimized on base, solvent, ligand; catalyst formed in-situ; Schlenk tube
used, optimization study
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of 3-Substituted and 2,3-Disubstituted Quinazolinones via
Cu-Catalyzed Aryl Amidation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Xu, Lanting; Jiang, Yongwen; Ma, Dawei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(4), 1150-1153

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Intermediate 70:
3-morpholino-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-4-amine: To intermediate 69
(0.450 g, 2.32 mmol), formamide (4 ml) was added and heated to 130°C for
12h. The reaction mass was quenched with water, extracted with ethyl
acetate, dried over sodium sulphate and concentrated The crude product
was purified by column chromatography with methanol: ethyl acetate to
afford the title compound. Intermediate 76:
3-(piperidin-1-yl)-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-4-amine: The title
compound was obtained as a brown solid (0.600 g, 95%) by using a
procedure that is similar to the one described for intermediate 70 from
intermediate 75 (0.550 g, 2.87 mmol) and formamide (5 ml). 1H-NMR (δ ppm,
DMSO-d6, 400 MHz): 12.44 (s, 1H), 8.07 (s, 1H), 6.69 (s, 2H), 3.05 (t, J=
5.1 Hz, 4H), 1.69 (m, 4H), 1.54 (m, 2H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 9e: Ethyl
6-(7-(benzyloxy)-4-oxo-3,4-dihydroquinazolin-6-yloxy)hexanoate (Compound
506-16). A mixture of Compound 505-16 (5.7 g, 13.3 mmol),
aminooxyformaldehyde (0.81 g, 13.3 mmol) in formamide (80 mL) was heated
to 190°C for 2h. The mixture was cooled to room temperature and the
formamide was removed under reduced pressure. The residue was poured into
ice-water. The resulting solid was collected by filtration, washed with
water (3X), dried. title compound 506-16 as a brown solid (5.7 g, 95%).
LCMS: 411 [M+1]+; 1H NMR (DMSO-d 6): δ 12.13 (brs, 1 H), 7.94 (s, 1 H),
7.47-7.32 (m, 6 H), 7.19 (s, 1 H), 5.26 (s, 2 H), 4.08- 3.97 (m, 4 H),
2.28 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 2 H), 1.79-1.70 (m, 2 H), 1.63- 1.56 (m, 2 H), 1.51-
1.38 (m, 2 H), 1.14 ( t, J = 6.6 Hz, 2 H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Quinazoline derivatives as VEGFR inhibitors, their preparation,
pharmaceutical compositions, and use in the treatment of cell
proliferative diseases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Qian, Changgeng; Cai, Xiong; Zhai, Haixiao
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2009036055 A1 2009-03-19

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine
(3a) To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk-tube equipped with a stirbar was
added Pd2(dba)3 · CHCl3 (20.8 mg, 0.02 mmol),
2-Di-t-butylphosphino-3,4,5,6-tetramethyl-2',4',6'-tri-i-propylbiphenyl
(L1) (48 mg, 0.1 mmol), K3PO4 (639 mg, 3.01 mmol) and
2-Chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)pyridin-3-amine (2a) (500 mg, 2.01 mmol) (if
solid). The tube was evacuated and refilled with Ar(g). Formamide (0.12
mL, 3.01 mmol) was added via syringe as a single portion, followed by the
chloropyridine (if liquid) in 4 mL of tert-butanol. The reaction mixture
was degassed with 3 x vacuum / Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction vessel
was then equipped with a cold-finger under a positive pressure of argon
gas and immersed in a 110°C pre-heated oil-bath for 4h at which time TLC
showed consumption of the chloro-pyridine. The reaction was cooled to
room temperature, diluted with MeOH (4 mL) filtered through a Celite plug
and concentrated to give a dark brown oil. The crude product was purified
on a silica gel column (4.5 cm x 12 cm), eluting with 4% MeOH in CH2Cl2.
1-(Pyridin-2-ylmethyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine (3f) Following the
general experimental; 2-chloro-N-(pyridin-2-ylmethyl)pyridin-3-amine (2f)
(93 mg, 0.4 mmol), Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol), L1 (9.6 mg,
0.02 mmol), K3PO4 (128 mg, 0.6 mmol), formamide (0.022 mL, 0.6 mmol) were
combined with 2.0 mL tert-butanol in a 25 mL Schlenk flask. After 4 h the
reaction was complete, the reaction cooled to RT, filtered through
Celite, concentrated and purified on a silica gel column (2.5 cm x 12
cm), eluting with 4% MeOH / CH2Cl2. 3f as 81 mg of a brown solid (95%).
1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.60 (ddd, J = 4.8 Hz, 1.5 Hz, 0.9 Hz, 1H),
8.57 (dd, J = 4.8 Hz, 1.5 Hz, 1H), 8.31 (s, 1H), 7.70 (dd, J = 8.1 Hz,
1.5 Hz, 1H), 7.65 (td, J = 7.8 Hz, 1.8 Hz, 1H), 7.28-7.22 (m, 1H), 7.20
(dd, J = 8.1 Hz, 4.8 Hz, 1H), 7.01 (d, J = 8.1 Hz, 1H), 5.50 (s, 2H); 13C
NMR (75.4 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 156.4, 154.8, 150.1, 145.7, 145.3, 145.2,
137.6, 123.5, 121.5, 118.7, 118.5, 51.3; FT-IR (NaCl, thin film) ν =
3391, 1647, 1614, 1495, 1419, 1439, 1379, 1363, 1292, 783 cm-1. HRMS
(ESI) Calc (C12H10N4): 210.0905, Found: 210.0905; MP: 165-169°C; Rf (4%
MeOH / CH2Cl2): 0.20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM thermal, Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of Imidazo[4,5-b]pyridines and Imidazo[4,5-b]pyrazines by
Palladium Catalyzed Amidation of 2-Chloro-3-amino-heterocycles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Rosenberg, Adam J.; Zhao, Jinbo; Clark, Daniel A.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(7), 1764-1767

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 64-18-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 64-18-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Example 3. Reductive amination of
1-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)-4,4-dimethyl-1-propen-3-one (V). One g (3.9 mmol)
of V, 2 ml of formic acid, and 20 ml of formamide were placed in a round
bottom flask equipped with thermometer, reflux condenser, and a heating
mantle. The reaction mixture was heated to 188-190°C and maintained at
this temperature for 10 minutes. The reaction mixture was left to cool to
room temperature overnight. The precipitated crystals were separated by
filtration, rinsed with water, and dried with vacuum, producing 70% of
N-[1-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)-4,4- dimethyl-1-propen-3-yl]-formamide (VI).
Example 4. Reductive amination of benzophenone (VII). The reaction
procedure for V was repeated with 5 g of benzophenone and the reaction
time of 15 minutes. The reaction produced 95% of benzhydrylformamide
(VIII)(isolated yield).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM thermal
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Improved method for the synthesis of substituted formylamines and
substituted amines
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Bobylev, Mikhail
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2009018353 A1 2009-02-05

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for CuI-catalyzed formation
of 3-substituted-4-quinazolines and 2,3-disubstituted-4(3H )-quinazolines
from 2-bromo-N-phenylbenzamide. For 3-substituted-4-quinazoline
(11a-11r). A Schlenk tube was charged with N-substituted 2-bromobenzamide
(0.25 mmol), CuI (5 mg, 0.025 mmol), trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline (3 mg,
0.025 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (163 mg, 0.5 mmol). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with argon before formamide (20 µL, 0.5 mmol) and 1 mL DMF was
added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 80 o C (or 90 o C for
substrate 7l) for 24 h. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, 5 mL of saturated NH4Cl solution was added. The mixture was
extracted with EtOAc and the organic layer was washed with water, brine
and dried over Na2SO4. After concentration in vacuo, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel. The desired
3-substituted 4-quinazoline. 3-Cyclohexylquinazolin-4(3H)-one (11m).5 54
mg, 95% yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.30 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 1H), 8.10
(s, 1H), 7.73-7.66 (m, 2H), 7.48 (t, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 4.82-4.76 (m, 1H),
1.99-1.90 (m, 4H), 1.78 (d, J = 13.2 Hz, 1H), 1.67-1.58 (m, 2H),
1.54-1.45 (m, 2H), 1.28-1.19 (m, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 160.77,
147.61, 143.99, 134.17, 127.34, 127.16, 127.03, 122.03, 53.45, 32.68
(2C), 25.99 (2C), 25.37; HRMS-ESI: m/z calcd for C14H17N2O [M + H]+:
229.1341, found 229.1333.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst formed in-situ; Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of 3-Substituted and 2,3-Disubstituted Quinazolinones via
Cu-Catalyzed Aryl Amidation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Xu, Lanting; Jiang, Yongwen; Ma, Dawei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(4), 1150-1153

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME143 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM R-XVIII. a. 2-(4-Cl-Benzylamino)-N-formyl-ethanol (55). A total of 1.85 g
of 2-(4-chloro-benzylamino)-ethanol (78, 10 mmol) was heated to 80 °C in
5 mL formamide for 1 h. When the reaction was completed (GC), the
reaction mixture was poured into 20 mL of water and extracted with 3 × 20
mL of ethylacetate. The organic phase collected was evaporated under
pressure, yielding a thick liquid (2.02 g; 95% yield). MS(EI):
M+(measured) = 213.1; M+(calc) = 213.1; 1H NMR (ppm): major (cis): 3.19
(2H, t, 5.4 Hz, NCH2), 3.39 (2H, t, 5.4 Hz, OCH2), 4.45 (2H, s, PhCH2),
7.28 (2H, d, 6.2 Hz, CH2,6), 7.36 (2H, d, 6.2 Hz, CH3,5), 8.11 (1H, s,
CHO); 13C NMR (ppm): 44.58 (PhCH2), 49.18 (NCH2), 58.70 (OCH2), 128.70
(2C, CH3,5), 128.88 (1C, CH1), 129.92 (2C, C2,6), 136.82 (1C, CH4),
163.74 (1C, CHO). minor (trans): 3.17 (2H, t, 5.4 Hz, NCH2), 3.39 (2H, t,
5.4 Hz, OCH2), 4.50 (2H, s, PhCH2), 7.24 (2H, d, 6.2 Hz, CH2,6), 7.34
(2H, d, 6.2 Hz, CH3,5), 8.28 (1H, s, CHO); 13C NMR (ppm): 50.20 (PhCH2),
49.18 (NCH2), 58.70 (OCH2), 128.70 (2C, CH3,5), 129.92 (1C, CH1), 129.98
(2C, C2,6), 136.84 (1C, CH4), 163.74 (1C, CHO).

$DATUM 4-Amino-7-t-butyltetrahydrobenzo[b]thieno[2,3-d]pyrimidine (5) A mixture
of 1 (5 mmol, 1.17 g) and formamide (504 mmol, 20 mL) was refluxed for
4h. The solid that precipitated on cooling was recrystallized from
ethanol to give 5 as pale yellow crystals. yield: 2.34 g (95%).
4-Amino-7-t-butyltetrahydrobenzo[b]thieno[2,3-d]pyrimidine (5). Yield
2.34 g (95%). m.p.: 155-157°C, IR, ν cm-1: 3419-3221 (NH2), 1H NMR
(CDCl3): δ 0.92 (s, 9H, tert-butyl group), 1.87-3.09 (several m, 7H,
cyclohexane), 7.92 (bs, 2H, NH2 , D2O exchangeable), 8.35 (s, 1H,
pyrimidine); Anal. calcd. for C14H19N3S (261): C, 64.37; H, 7.28; N,
16.09; found: C, 64.20; H, 7.10; N,15.90.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 4 -synthesis of 4-amino-6-chloro-quinazoline A solution of
2-amino-5-chlorobenzonitrile (1.07 g, 7.0 mmol) in formamide (20 ml) was
heated at 180 °C for 6 hours. After cooling to room temperature, water
(30 ml) was added to the reaction mixture. The precipitate was collected
by filtration, washed with water and dried over P2O5, yielding the title
compound as a grey solid (1.2 g, yield: 95 %) which was characterized by
its mass spectrum as follows. MS (m/z): 180 ([M+H]+, 100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

treating viral infection and their preparation

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
1-(4-Bromophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine (24). The
standard procedure involved the treatment of
5-amino-1-(4-bromophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole (8; 102 mg, 0.29 mmol, 1.0
equiv) with PBr3 (80 μL, 0.87 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2
mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
24: 95% yield (96 mg), yellow solid. Mp 176-177 °C (hexane-EtOAc). 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 7.45-7.57 (3H, m), 7.60-7.66 (2H, m), 7.98-8.06 (2H,
m), 8.21-8.29 (2H, m), 9.10 (1H, s), 9.47 (1H, s). 13C NMR (125 MHz,
CDCl3): δ 114.3, 120.0, 122.4 (2 × C), 127.3 (2 × C), 129.2 (2 × C),
130.0, 131.2, 132.2 (2 × C), 137.6, 145.2, 152.8, 153.4, 155.6. IR (KBr):
2374, 2347, 1585, 1495, 1398, 1389, 1215, 1072 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int):
350 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C17H11BrN4: C, 58.14; H, 3.16; N, 15.95.
Found: C, 58.16; H, 3.18; N, 15.91.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sequential three-component heterocyclization, one-pot multi-component
process

Three-Component Heterocyclization

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
N,N′-Diarylformamidines (50-56 and 73). The reliable procedure involved
the treatment of arylamines (43-49; 1.0 equiv) or 3-aminopyridine (68;
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60
°C over 0.5-1.0 h. When the reaction was complete, the crude solid was
triturated in cold n-pentane and filtered through a glass frit with
suction. Then the solid was washed with n-pentane and dried in vacuo to
give the crude formamidines (50-56 and 73). The crude products were
recrystallized from the mixture of acetone and diisopropyl ether to give
the corresponding N,N′-diarylformamidine products (50-56 and 73) in
88-97% yields as white to light yellow solids.
N,N'-Bis(2-methoxyphenyl)formamidine (52)..20,33 The standard procedure
involved the treatment of 2-anisidine (45; 51 mg, 0.41 mmol, 1.0 equiv)
with PBr3 (0.12 mL, 1.2 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at
50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up, and the
residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure 52: 95%
yield (100 mg), yellow solid. Mp 82-84 °C (CH2Cl2-methanol). 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 200 MHz): δ 3.67 (6H, s), 7.04-6.86 (8H, m), 7.95 (1H, s), 8.22
(1H, s). 13C NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3): δ 55.6, 56.2, 110.9, 117.1 (2 × C),
121.0 (2 × C), 123.3 (2 × C), 134.5 (2 × C), 147.2, 150.1, 159.6, 162.7.
IR (KBr): 3315, 3126, 3037, 2987, 2889, 2813, 1664, 1591, 1459, 1300,
1236, 1021 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 256 (31, M+). Anal. Calcd for
C15H16N2O2: C, 70.29; H, 6.29; N, 10.93. Found: C, 70.33; H, 6.31; N,
10.96.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM d) 5-Ethyl-4-(1H-imidazol-4-yl)-3-phenyl-isoxazole A mixture of
2-bromo-1-(5-ethyl-3-phenyl-isoxazol-4-yl)-ethanone (0.47 g, 2 mmol) and
formamide (5 mL) was heated at 160 °C overnight. After cooling to room
temperature, water (20 mL) was then added and the resulting mixture
extracted with ethyl acetate. The combined organic extracts were then
evaporated to leave the title compound (0.45 g, 95%) as a brown solid.
MS: m/e = 240.1 [M+H]+.

$DATUM 31-309-CAS-10543465
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD

$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Formamide (528 μL, 13.3 mmol) and P2S5 (6.5 .g, 14.63 mmol) were stirred
in acetonitrile for 30 minutes, until the suspension became an
unstirrable paste. The supernatant was decanted and added to an
acetonitrile solution of
2-bromo-1-(5-bromo-2-chloropyridin-3-yl)-2-(2,3-dichlorophenyl)ethanone
(0.609 g,1.33 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature
overnight. The solids were removed by filtration, rinsed with methylene
chloride, and the filtrate was concentrated and taken up in ethyl ether.
The organics were filtered through silica, which was washed with diethyl
ether. The filtrate was concentrated and the product obtained by
crystallization from hexanes/ether to provide
5-bromo-2-chloro-3-(5-(2,3-dichlorophenyl)thiazol-4-yl)pyridine as a
white solid [532 mg, 95 % yield].
5-bromo-2-chloro-3-(5-(2,3-dichlorophenyl)thiazol-4-yl)pyridine, yield
532 mg, 95 % LC-MS, M+H = 419.0; 1H-NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) 8.51 (1H, s),
8.36 (1H, d), 7.78 (1H, d), 7.42 (1H, dd), 7.01-7.11 (2H, m).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of tetrazolyl (or triazolyl) substituted pyridinamines or
pyrimidinamines as c-Met protein kinase inhibitors
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Brian; Farmer, Luc; Bethiel, Randy Scott; Jacobs, Dylan; Mcginty, Kira

$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2007111904 A2 2007-10-04

$DATUM 7550-35-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of Amides from Alcohols; General
Procedure. LiBr (87 mg, 1.0 mmol) and amide (7.5 mmol) were successively
added to a mixture of alcohol (0.5 mmol) and TFA (1.15 mL, 15.0 mmol) in
a screw-cap tube. After the reaction mixture was stirred at 90 °C for 8
h, sat. NaHCO3 (30 mL) was added, and the resultant mixture was extracted
with EtOAc (100 mL). The combined extracts were washed with sat. NaHCO3
and brine, dried (MgSO4), and concentrated under reduced pressure. The
residue was purified by performing silica gel column chromatography to
give the pure amide. N-(2-Methyl-2-dodecyl)formamide (1b). Yield: 94%.
colorless oil; Reactant: Formamide: (15.0 equiv), TFA (30.0 equiv), Metal
halide: LiBr (2.0 equiv), Reactions were carried out for 8 h. IR (neat):
3282 (br), 3055, 2954, 2924, 2854, 2754, 1686, 1670, 1541, 1468, 1385,
1365, 1265 cm-1. 1H NMR (600 MHz, CDCl3): δ (major) = 8.18 (d, J = 12.4
Hz, 1 H), 6.03 (br s, 1 H), 1.49-1.45 (m, 2 H), 1.34-1.20 (m, 22 H), 0.86
(t, J = 6.9 Hz, 3 H); δ (minor) = 8.01 (s, 1 H), 5.28 (br s, 1 H),
1.67-1.63 (m, 2 H), 1.34-1.20 (m, 22 H), 0.86 (t, J = 6.9 Hz, 3 H). 13C
NMR (150 MHz, CDCl3): δ (major) = 163.2, 52.9, 43.9, 32.0, 30.0, 29.8,
29.7, 29.7, 29.4, 28.8, 23.9, 22.8, 14.2; δ (minor) = 160.5, 54.1, 40.8,
32.0, 30.1, 29.8, 29.7, 29.7, 29.4, 27.1, 24.2, 22.8, 14.2. HRMS (ESI):
m/z [M + Na]+ calcd for C14H29NNaO: 250.2147; found: 250.2148.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM TFA also used as solvent, optimized on reagents, optimization study
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Facile synthesis of N-substituted amides from alcohols and amides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Okada, Iku; Chiba, Kazuhiro; Kitano, Yoshikazu
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
