$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
3-(4-Methoxylphenyl)-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine (32). The
standard procedure involved the treatment of
5-amino-3-(4-methoxylphenyl)-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazole (16; 101 mg, 0.33 mmol,
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (90 μL, 1.0 mmol, 3 equiv) in formamide solution (2
mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
32: 94% yield (94 mg), yellow solid. Mp 175-176 °C (hexane-EtOAc). 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 3.87 (3H, s), 7.08-7.84 (2H, m), 7.32-7.36 (1H, m),
7.50-7.56 (2H, m), 7.95- 8.01 (2H, m), 8.28-8.32 (2H, m), 9.10 (1H, s),
9.45 (1H, s). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 55.4 (CH3), 114.2, 114.6 (2 ×
C), 121.3 (2 × C), 124.1, 126.7, 128.7 (2 × C), 129.2 (2 × C), 138.6,
144.8, 152.8, 153.2, 155.5, 160.8. IR (KBr): 3047, 2924, 1612, 1582,
1503, 1431, 1356, 1254, 1219, 1092 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 302 (100,
M+). Anal. Calcd for C18H14N4O: C, 71.51; H, 4.67; N, 18.53. Found: C,
71.48; H, 4.68; N, 18.50.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sequential three-component heterocyclization, one-pot multi-component
process
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Three-Component Heterocyclization

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for Amination All the
experiments were carried out in a parallel synthesizer from REDLEYS
Discovery Technologies, UK. A solution of acid chloride 1a (1.0 gm 7.11
mmol) in formamide (10 ml) was heated to 100-120 °C and maintained at
same temperature for 5 to 6 hours, the reaction mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The reaction mass quenched in excess water and
extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic solvent was washed
with saturated NaHCO3 aqueous solution and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to give the residue
which was purified by column chromatography using silica gel and EtOAc=
hexane as eluent. An amount of 0.77 g (6.4 mmol, 90%) of 2a was obtained
as crystals. Compound 2m. Yield 94% Mp in °C (Lit): 109-110; Mp in °C
(Obs.): 108-111
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM excess water used in stage 2, no solvent

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: (25) General Procedure for the Synthesis of
Formanilides 2 To an open flask containing a solution of arylboronic acid
1 (1.0 mmol) in formamide (2 mL) were added Cu(OAc)2·H2O (19.9 mg, 10
mol%) and K2CO3 (138.2 mg, 1 mmol), and the mixture was stirred
vigorously at r.t. under air (without bubbling air) for 8-16 h (Table 2).
After completion of the reaction (indicated by TLC), the reaction mixture
was treated with EtOAc (5 mL) and H2O (5 mL). The organic layer was
separated, and the aqueous layer was extracted with EtOAc (3 × 5 mL). The
combined organic phase was washed with H2O (2 × 5 mL), dried over anhyd
Na2SO4, and concentrated to yield a residue, which was purified by flash
chromatography (prepacked silica cartridges). The clean product 2 as a
mixture of rotamers.27 All the products are known compounds and were
characterized by comparison of their melting points and spectral data
with those reported in the literature.14-17 N-Phenylformamide (2a, Table
2)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM aerobic, no solvent, Chan-Lam coupling

$DATUM Copper-catalyzed formamidation of arylboronic acids: direct access to
formanilides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srivastava, Vishnu P.; Yadav, Deepak K.; Yadav, Arvind K.; Watal, Geeta;
Yadav, Lal Dhar S.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2013), 24(11), 1423-1427

$DATUM Step A - Synthesis of Compound 32A A solution of 5C (0.20 g, 1.33 mmol)
in formamide (15 mL) was heated to 150 °C and stirred for 18 hours. After
cooled to room temperature, ethyl acetate (60 mL) and water (30 mL) were
added and the layers were separated. The organic solution was washed with
water (3x20 mL), dried (MgSO4), filtered, and concentrated in vacuo to
provide the crude product 32A (0.22 g, 93 %). Compound 32A, yield (0.22
g, 93 %). MS found for C9H8FN3: 178.2 (M+H)+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step A — Synthesis of Compound 33B A solution of 33A (0.20 g, 1.33 mmol)
in formamide (15 mL) was heated to 150 °C and allowed to stir for 18
hours. After cooled to room temperature, ethyl acetate (60 mL) and water
(30 mL) were added and the layers were separated. The organic solution
was washed with water (3x20 mL), dried (MgSO4), filtered, and
concentrated in vacuo to provide the crude product 33B (0.22 g, 93 %). MS
found for C9H8FN3: 178.2 (M+H)+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of substituted indole derivatives for inhibition of hepatitis
C virus
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: (25) General Procedure for the Synthesis of
Formanilides 2 To an open flask containing a solution of arylboronic acid
1 (1.0 mmol) in formamide (2 mL) were added Cu(OAc)2·H2O (19.9 mg, 10
mol%) and K2CO3 (138.2 mg, 1 mmol), and the mixture was stirred
vigorously at r.t. under air (without bubbling air) for 8-16 h (Table 2).
After completion of the reaction (indicated by TLC), the reaction mixture
was treated with EtOAc (5 mL) and H2O (5 mL). The organic layer was
separated, and the aqueous layer was extracted with EtOAc (3 × 5 mL). The
combined organic phase was washed with H2O (2 × 5 mL), dried over anhyd
Na2SO4, and concentrated to yield a residue, which was purified by flash
chromatography (prepacked silica cartridges). The clean product 2 as a
mixture of rotamers.27 All the products are known compounds and were
characterized by comparison of their melting points and spectral data
with those reported in the literature.14-17 N-Phenylformamide (2a, Table
2)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM aerobic, no solvent, Chan-Lam coupling
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper-catalyzed formamidation of arylboronic acids: direct access to
formanilides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srivastava, Vishnu P.; Yadav, Deepak K.; Yadav, Arvind K.; Watal, Geeta;
Yadav, Lal Dhar S.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2013), 24(11), 1423-1427

$DATUM 93
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for Amination All the
experiments were carried out in a parallel synthesizer from REDLEYS
Discovery Technologies, UK. A solution of acid chloride 1a (1.0 gm 7.11
mmol) in formamide (10 ml) was heated to 100-120 °C and maintained at
same temperature for 5 to 6 hours, the reaction mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The reaction mass quenched in excess water and
extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic solvent was washed
with saturated NaHCO3 aqueous solution and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to give the residue
which was purified by column chromatography using silica gel and EtOAc=
hexane as eluent. An amount of 0.77 g (6.4 mmol, 90%) of 2a was obtained
as crystals. Compound 2h. Yield 93% Mp in °C (Lit): 182-184; Mp in °C
(Obs.): 180-184
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM excess water used in stage 2, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Formamide as an ammonia synthon in amination of acid chlorides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srinivasan, S.; Manisankar, P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2010), 40(23), 3538-3543

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM The crude 2-(bromoacetyl)-5-furanphosphonic acid diethyl ester (146 mg,
0.45 mmol) was dissolved in anhydrous benzene (2 mL) and treated with
formamide (61 mg, 1.35 mmol) and P4S10 (60 mg, 0.135 mmol). The resulting
mixture was heated to reflux under nitrogen. After 1 h, the reaction was
cooled, quenched with water (10 mL) and saturated sodium bicarbonate (10
mL), and then extracted with CH2Cl2 (2 × 20 mL). The organic extracts
were combined, dried (MgSO4) and evaporated to give a yellow oil, which
was purified by flash chromatography (SiO2, 2 × 15 cm, 65% EtOAc-hexane)
to give 16 as a yellow oil (120 mg, 93%). 1H NMR(CDCl3) δ 8.83 (s, 1H),
7.69 (s, 1H), 7.20 (m, 1H), 6.91 (m, 1H), 4.18 (m, 4H), 1.38 (t, 6H, J =
7.2 Hz).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Discovery of Potent and Specific Fructose-1,6-Bisphosphatase Inhibitors
and a Series of Orally-Bioavailable Phosphoramidase-Sensitive Prodrugs
for the Treatment of Type 2 Diabetes

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
N,N′-Diarylformamidines (50-56 and 73). The reliable procedure involved
the treatment of arylamines (43-49; 1.0 equiv) or 3-aminopyridine (68;
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60
°C over 0.5-1.0 h. When the reaction was complete, the crude solid was
triturated in cold n-pentane and filtered through a glass frit with
suction. Then the solid was washed with n-pentane and dried in vacuo to
give the crude formamidines (50-56 and 73). The crude products were
recrystallized from the mixture of acetone and diisopropyl ether to give
the corresponding N,N′-diarylformamidine products (50-56 and 73) in
88-97% yields as white to light yellow solids.
N,N'-Bis(3-fluorophenyl)formamidine (55).35 The standard procedure
involved the treatment of 3-fluoroaniline (48; 50 mg, 0.52 mmol, 1.0
equiv) with PBr3 (0.15 mL, 1.6 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2
mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
55: 93% yield (108 mg), yellow oil (CH2Cl2- methanol). 1H NMR (CDCl3, 200
MHz): δ 6.22-6.28 (2H, m), 6.32-6.36 (1H, m), 7.14-7.18 (4H, m),
7.25-7.29 (1H, m), 7.48 (1H, s), 8.01 (1H, s). 13C NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3): δ
103.6, 106.5, 109.1, 111.8, 113.9, 118.6, 130.8 (2 × C), 143.6, 150.8,
163.0, 164.8, 165.2. IR (KBr): 3132, 2968, 2827, 1655, 1574, 1481, 1466,
1280, 1257, 1214, 1169, 1109, 1017 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 232 (100,
M+). Anal. Calcd for C13H10F2N2: C, 67.24; H, 4.32; N, 12.06. Found: C,
67.20; H, 4.36; N, 12.02.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 6-Methyl-5-(4-nitrophenyl)thieno[2,3-d]pyrimidin-4- amine (5). A
suspension of 4 (4.03 g, 15.5 mmol) in formamide (60 mL) was stirred at
155 °C for 17 h, cooled to room temperature, diluted with water, and
filtered. The filter cake was dried to provide the title compound (4.13
g, 93%). 1H NMR (DMSO-d 6) δ 8.36 (d, J = 9.0 Hz, 2H), 8.30 (s, 1H), 7.68
(d, J = 9.0 Hz, 2H), 2.32 (s, 3H); MS (CI) m/z 287 (M + H)+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for Amination All the
experiments were carried out in a parallel synthesizer from REDLEYS
Discovery Technologies, UK. A solution of acid chloride 1a (1.0 gm 7.11
mmol) in formamide (10 ml) was heated to 100-120 °C and maintained at
same temperature for 5 to 6 hours, the reaction mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The reaction mass quenched in excess water and
extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic solvent was washed
with saturated NaHCO3 aqueous solution and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to give the residue
which was purified by column chromatography using silica gel and EtOAc=
hexane as eluent. An amount of 0.77 g (6.4 mmol, 90%) of 2a was obtained
as crystals. Compound 2c. Yield 93% Mp in °C (Lit): 142-144; Mp in °C
(Obs.): 140-144
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM excess water used in stage 2, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Formamide as an ammonia synthon in amination of acid chlorides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srinivasan, S.; Manisankar, P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2010), 40(23), 3538-3543

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME244 STEP1

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for CuI-catalyzed formation
of 3-substituted-4-quinazolines and 2,3-disubstituted-4(3H )-quinazolines
from 2-bromo-N-phenylbenzamide. For 3-substituted-4-quinazoline
(11a-11r). A Schlenk tube was charged with N-substituted 2-bromobenzamide
(0.25 mmol), CuI (5 mg, 0.025 mmol), trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline (3 mg,
0.025 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (163 mg, 0.5 mmol). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with argon before formamide (20 µL, 0.5 mmol) and 1 mL DMF was
added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 80 o C (or 90 o C for
substrate 7l) for 24 h. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, 5 mL of saturated NH4Cl solution was added. The mixture was
extracted with EtOAc and the organic layer was washed with water, brine
and dried over Na2SO4. After concentration in vacuo, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel. The desired
3-substituted 4-quinazoline. 3-Benzylquinazolin-4(3H)-one (11p).1 55 mg,
93% yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.34 (dd, J 1 = 1.2 Hz, J 2 = 8.0
Hz, 1H), 8.11 (s, 1H), 7.78-7.70 (m, 2H), 7.53-7.49 (m, 1H), 7.36-7.31
(m, 5H), 5.21 (s, 2H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 161.16, 148.10, 146.45,
135.81, 134.42, 129.12 (2C), 128.41, 128.10 (2C), 127.60, 127.49, 126.98,
122.29, 49.71; HRMS-ESI: m/z calcd for C15H13N2O [M + H]+, 237.1028,
found 237.1013.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst formed in-situ; Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of 3-Substituted and 2,3-Disubstituted Quinazolinones via
Cu-Catalyzed Aryl Amidation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Xu, Lanting; Jiang, Yongwen; Ma, Dawei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(4), 1150-1153

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Transamidation Reaction.
Amide (5.1 mmol) and amine (3.0 mmol) were dissolved or suspended in
toluene (3.0 mL), Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (61 mg, 0.15 mmol) was added, and the
mixture was refluxed until complete conversion (by TLC) of the amine. The
hot reaction mixture was filtered through a pad of Celite, concentrated,
and purified by flash chromatography as indicated below.
N-Benzylacetamide (7). The crude mixture was purified by flash
chromatography with DCM. N-Formyl-4-aminoantipyrine (13d). The crude
mixture was purified by flash chromatography with DCM. The product was
obtained as a beige solid. Yield: 644 mg, 93%. The presence of two
rotamers was observed in the NMR spectra in an 0.85 (M):0.15 (m) ratio.
Mp: 188-190 °C (lit.27 192-194 °C). 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm) 9.21
(s, 1H), 8.47 (m) (d, J = 11.4 Hz, 1H), 8.23 (M) (d, J = 1.2 Hz, 1H),
7.27-7.50 (m, 5H), 3.10 (s, 3H), 2.25 (s, 3H). 13C{1H} NMR (75 MHz,
CDCl3): δ (ppm) 160.5, 149.8, 134.2, 129.3, 127.4, 127.1, 124.7, 124.2,
107.0, 36.1, 35.7, 12.1. IR (ν, cm-1, KBr): 3180, 3111, 3055, 2934, 2877,
1688, 1644, 1590. HRMS: calcd for C12H14N3O2, 232.1086; found, 232.1085.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 4-Oxo-3,4,7,8,9,10-hexahydropyrimido[4',5':4,5]furo[2,3-b]quinoline (4).
A mixture of amino ester 3 (2.9 g, 10 mmol) and formamide (30 ml) was
heated at 200-205°C for 3 h. The crystalline precipitate formed upon
cooling was filtered off, thoroughly washed with water and ethanol, and
recrystallized from ethanol. Yield, %: 93. 1H NMR spectrum, δ, ppm (J,
Hz): 12.85 (1H, br. s, NH); 8.10 (1H, s, N═CH); 7.95 (1H, s, ═CH); 3.05
(4H, m, H-7,10); 1.95 (4H, m, H-8,9). Empirical formula: C13H11N3O2,
Found, %: C 67.22, H 4.38, N 17.95, Calculated, %: C 67.72, H 4.59, N
17.42, mp, °C: 305-306.

$DATUM a) 2-(4-Morpholinyl)[1,3]thiazolo[4,5-d]pyrimidin-7(4H)-one (3) A sealed
tube was charged with methyl
4-amino-2-(4-morpholinyl)-1,3-thiazole-5-carboxylate (4 g, 16.44 mmol)
and formamide (40 mL, 1004 mmol). The reaction was heated at 150 °C
overnight. The reaction mixture was cooled, filtered, and the solid was
washed with DCM and MeOH. The solid was collected and dried under vacuum
to give product. Yield 3.65g ,93%. LCMS (ES) m/z =239.0 (M+H)+, 1H NMR
(400 MHz, DMSO-d6) δ ppm 12.4 (br s, 1H, NH), 8.10 (s, 1H) 3.72 (m, 4H).
3.58 (m, 4H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: (25) General Procedure for the Synthesis of
Formanilides 2 To an open flask containing a solution of arylboronic acid
1 (1.0 mmol) in formamide (2 mL) were added Cu(OAc)2·H2O (19.9 mg, 10
mol%) and K2CO3 (138.2 mg, 1 mmol), and the mixture was stirred
vigorously at r.t. under air (without bubbling air) for 8-16 h (Table 2).
After completion of the reaction (indicated by TLC), the reaction mixture
was treated with EtOAc (5 mL) and H2O (5 mL). The organic layer was
separated, and the aqueous layer was extracted with EtOAc (3 × 5 mL). The
combined organic phase was washed with H2O (2 × 5 mL), dried over anhyd
Na2SO4, and concentrated to yield a residue, which was purified by flash
chromatography (prepacked silica cartridges). The clean product 2 as a
mixture of rotamers.27 All the products are known compounds and were
characterized by comparison of their melting points and spectral data
with those reported in the literature.14-17 N-Phenylformamide (2a, Table
2)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM aerobic, no solvent, Chan-Lam coupling
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper-catalyzed formamidation of arylboronic acids: direct access to
formanilides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srivastava, Vishnu P.; Yadav, Deepak K.; Yadav, Arvind K.; Watal, Geeta;
Yadav, Lal Dhar S.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2013), 24(11), 1423-1427

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
N,N′-Diarylformamidines (50-56 and 73). The reliable procedure involved
the treatment of arylamines (43-49; 1.0 equiv) or 3-aminopyridine (68;
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60
°C over 0.5-1.0 h. When the reaction was complete, the crude solid was
triturated in cold n-pentane and filtered through a glass frit with
suction. Then the solid was washed with n-pentane and dried in vacuo to
give the crude formamidines (50-56 and 73). The crude products were
recrystallized from the mixture of acetone and diisopropyl ether to give
the corresponding N,N′-diarylformamidine products (50-56 and 73) in
88-97% yields as white to light yellow solids.
N,N'-Bis(4-methoxyphenyl)formamidine (53).34 The standard procedure
involved the treatment of 4-anisidine (46; 49 mg, 0.40 mmol, 1.0 equiv)
with PBr3 (0.11 mL, 1.2 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at
50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up, and the
residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure 53: 92%
yield (94 mg), yellow solid. Mp 118-119 °C (CH2Cl2-methanol). 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 200 MHz): δ 3.66 (6H, s), 6.54-7.26, (8H, m), 7.89 (1H, s), 8.07
(1H, s). 13C NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3): δ 56.9, 57.8, 114.9, 115.2, 118.3 (2 ×
C), 124.3 (2 × C), 135.2 (2 × C), 139.8 (2 × C), 149.5, 160.1, 163.7. IR
(KBr): 3313, 3136, 3022, 2991, 2886, 2804, 1675, 1577, 1465, 1301, 1247,
1036 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 256 (51, M+). Anal. Calcd for C15H16N2O2:
C, 70.29; H, 6.29; N, 10.93. Found: C, 70.26; H, 6.32; N, 10.91.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure Pd-Catalyzed Amidation of
Aryl Halides and Sulfonates (Tables 2, 3 and 4). An oven-dried Schlenk
tube was evacuated and backfilled with argon. [If 3Å molecular sieves
were used, they were activated by heating under reduced pressure and
backfilling the Schlenk tube with argon (this sequence was repeated three
times) at this time.] The Schlenk tube was charged with Pd2dba3 (0.25-4.0
mol % Pd), ligand (0.60-10 mol %) and K3PO4 or K2CO3 (1.0-2.2 equiv). If
the aryl chloride (1.0 equiv) and/or amide (1.0-1.5 equiv) were a solid,
these were also added at this time. The tube was evacuated and backfilled
with argon (this sequence was repeated three times). If the aryl chloride
and/or amide (1.0-1.5 equiv) were a liquid, these were added to the tube
at this time along with t-BuOH. The mixture was stirred in a pre-heated
oil bath (90-110 °C) until the aryl halide was consumed as judged by TLC,
LC-MS or GC analysis (2-24 h, reaction times were not optimized). The
reaction mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature, diluted with
ethyl acetate (or MeOH in case the product was insoluble in ethyl
acetate), and the resultant solution was filtered through Celite, and
concentrated under reduced pressure. The crude material was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel. The crude material was purified by
column chromatography (eluting with hexanes/ethyl acetate = 2/1).
4-Methylformanilide, white solid, yield 124 mg, 92%. Mp = 53-54 °C
(lit.[6] 55-57 °C). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ: (equilibrium mixture of
E/Z isomers) 8.72 (br-s, 0.55H), 8.61 (d, J = 11.6 Hz, 0.55H), 8.30 (s,
0.45H), 7.81 (br-s, 0.45H), 7.41 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 0.90H), 7.14-7.09 (m,
2H), 6.97 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 1.10H), 2.31 and 2.29 (each s, total 3H). 13C
NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ: (equilibrium mixture of E/Z isomers) 163.3,
159.5, 135.3, 134.6, 134.6, 134.4, 130.4, 129.7, 120.3, 119.3, 21.1,
21.0. Anal. Calcd for C8H9NO: C, 71.09; H, 6.71. Found: C, 70.96; H,
6.73.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Pd-Catalyzed Amidations of Aryl Chlorides Using Monodentate Biaryl
Phosphine Ligands: A Kinetic, Computational, and Synthetic Investigation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Ikawa, Takashi; Barder, Timothy E.; Biscoe, Mark R.; Buchwald, Stephen L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129(43), 13001-13007

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM The piperazine intermediate from the above reaction (355 mg, 1.14 mmol)
and formamide (171 mg, 3.8 mmol) was dissolved in DMF (5 mL). The
solution was heated to 105 °C, and a solution of sodium methoxide (5.4 M
in MeOH, 148 μL) was slowly added over 15 min. After 1 h at 105 °C, an
additional portion of sodium methoxide (63 μL) was added, and heating was
continued for another hour. The reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, diluted with water, and extracted sequentially with ethyl
acetate and with CH2Cl2. The combined organic layers were dried over
Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated. Purification by flash chromatography
(ethyl acetate/AcOH/H2O, 700:110:90 to 650:130:120) afforded 6
(monoacetate, 358 mg, 92%) as a solid.
2-[3-(4-Methylpiperazin-1-yl)naphthalen-1-yl]acetamide (6), yield (358
mg, 92%). ES-MS: 284 [M + H]+, 306 [M + Na]+. HRMS: calcd for C17H22N3O
[M + H]+ 284.175 74, found 284.175 84. 1H NMR (DMSO-d6, 500 MHz,
trifluoroacetate salt): δ 2.88 (s, 3H), 3.01-3.12 (m, 2H), 3.16-3.27 (br,
2H), 3.53-3.63 (br, 2H), 3.81 (s, 2H), 3.91-4.01 (br, 2H), 6.97 (s, 1H),
7.19 (s, 1H), 7.33 (dd, J = 8.4, 7.4 Hz, 1H), 7.34 (s, 1H), 7.42 (dd, J =
8.2, 7.4 Hz, 1H), 7.54 (s, 1H), 7.75 (d, J = 8.2 Hz, 1H), 7.93 (d, J =
8.4 Hz, 1H), 10.08-10.20 (br, 1H). 13C NMR (DMSO-d6, 125.8 MHz,
trifluoroacetate salt): δ 39.01, 42.12, 45.88 (2x), 52.28 (2x), 109.40,
121.14, 123.52, 124.00, 126.04, 127.28, 127.40, 134.01, 134.54, 146.72,
171.99. IR (FTIR microscope, transmission, trifluoroacetate salt) νmax
3371, 3198, 3032, 2841, 2733, 2621, 2489, 1673, 1624, 1602, 1509, 1458,
1407, 1272, 1235, 1060 cm-1.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for Amination All the
experiments were carried out in a parallel synthesizer from REDLEYS
Discovery Technologies, UK. A solution of acid chloride 1a (1.0 gm 7.11
mmol) in formamide (10 ml) was heated to 100-120 °C and maintained at
same temperature for 5 to 6 hours, the reaction mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The reaction mass quenched in excess water and
extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic solvent was washed
with saturated NaHCO3 aqueous solution and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to give the residue
which was purified by column chromatography using silica gel and EtOAc=
hexane as eluent. An amount of 0.77 g (6.4 mmol, 90%) of 2a was obtained
as crystals. Compound 2i. Yield 92% Mp in °C (Lit): 172-176; Mp in °C
(Obs.): 170-172
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM excess water used in stage 2, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Formamide as an ammonia synthon in amination of acid chlorides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srinivasan, S.; Manisankar, P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2010), 40(23), 3538-3543

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM [00409] Step C: Preparation of
7-methoxy-8-methyl-2-[(4-trifluoromethyl-thiazole-2-yl)-quinazolin-4-ol
206. Compound 205 (2.5 g, 1 eq.) was refluxed in formamide (20 mL) at 160
°C. for 5 hrs. Water was then added and the reaction mixture was
extracted with EtOAc. Organics were dried over Na2SO4, filtered,
concentrated under reduced pressure, and purified by silica gel
chromatography (DCM) to yield compound 206 as a brown solid in 92% yield.
1H NMR (CDCl3, 400 MHz) δ (ppm) 2.46 (s, 3H), 3.92 (s, 3H), 7.07 (d,
J=9.28 Hz, 1H), 7.92 (s, 1H), 8.15 (d, J=9.28 Hz, 1H), 9.87 (s, 1H).

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Transamidation Reaction.
Amide (5.1 mmol) and amine (3.0 mmol) were dissolved or suspended in
toluene (3.0 mL), Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (61 mg, 0.15 mmol) was added, and the
mixture was refluxed until complete conversion (by TLC) of the amine. The
hot reaction mixture was filtered through a pad of Celite, concentrated,
and purified by flash chromatography as indicated below.
N-Benzylacetamide (7). The crude mixture was purified by flash
chromatography with DCM. N-(9-Ethyl-9H-carbazol-3-yl)formamide (13b). The
crude mixture was purified by flash chromatography with DCM/AcOEt (8:2).
The product was obtained as white crystals. Yield: 657 mg, 92%. The
presence of two rotamers was observed in the NMR spectra; however, it is
not possible to differentiate all the signals corresponding to each
isomer. Mp: 149-150 °C (lit.26 148 °C). 1H NMR (300 MHz, DMSO): δ (ppm)
9.99-10.33 (m, 1H), 8.74 (d, J = 11.1 Hz, 1H), 8.26-8.57 (m, 1H),
7.93-8.17 (m, 1H), 7.47-7.78 (m, 3H), 7.12-7.50 (m, 2H), 4.41 (d, J = 7.1
Hz, 2H), 1.29 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 3H). 13C{1H} NMR (75 MHz, DMSO): δ (ppm)
163.5, 159.6, 140.5, 140.5, 137.2, 136.8, 130.8, 130.6, 126.5, 126.3,
123.0, 122.4, 122.4, 122.3, 121.0, 120.7, 119.0, 118.7, 111.6, 110.7,
110.2, 109.6, 37.4, 14.1. IR (ν, cm-1, KBr): 3240, 3049, 2967, 2872,
1654, 1541, 1474. HRMS: calcd for C15H15N2O, 239.1184; found, 239.1177.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for CuI-catalyzed formation
of 3-substituted-4-quinazolines and 2,3-disubstituted-4(3H )-quinazolines
from 2-bromo-N-phenylbenzamide. For 3-substituted-4-quinazoline
(11a-11r). A Schlenk tube was charged with N-substituted 2-bromobenzamide
(0.25 mmol), CuI (5 mg, 0.025 mmol), trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline (3 mg,
0.025 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (163 mg, 0.5 mmol). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with argon before formamide (20 µL, 0.5 mmol) and 1 mL DMF was
added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 80 o C (or 90 o C for
substrate 7l) for 24 h. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, 5 mL of saturated NH4Cl solution was added. The mixture was
extracted with EtOAc and the organic layer was washed with water, brine
and dried over Na2SO4. After concentration in vacuo, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel. The desired
3-substituted 4-quinazoline.
6-Methoxy-3-(4-methoxy-2-methylphenyl)quinazolin-4(3H)-one (11j).3 68 mg,
92% yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.89 (s, 1H), 7.72 (d, J = 10.4 Hz,
2H ), 7.40 (dd, J 1 = 3.2 Hz, J 2 = 9.2 Hz, 1H), 7.16 (d, J = 8.4 Hz,
1H), 6.90-6.86 (m, 2H), 3.93 (s, 3H), 3.85 (s, 3H), 2.15 (s, 3H); 13C NMR
(100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 160.75, 160.29, 159.05, 144.82, 142.67, 137.22,
129.68, 129.18, 128.91, 124.73, 123.36, 116.54, 112.54, 106.69, 55.99,
55.61, 18.11. HRMS-ESI: m/z calcd for C17H17N2O3 [M + H]+: 297.1239,
found 297.1214.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst formed in-situ; Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of 3-Substituted and 2,3-Disubstituted Quinazolinones via
Cu-Catalyzed Aryl Amidation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Xu, Lanting; Jiang, Yongwen; Ma, Dawei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(4), 1150-1153

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
3-Phenyl-1-(quinolin-2-yl)-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine (27). The
standard procedure involved the treatment of
5-amino-3-phenyl-1-(quinolin-2-yl)-1H-pyrazole (11; 101 mg, 0.31 mmol,
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (90 μL, 0.94 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution
(2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
27: 93% yield (91 mg), yellow solid. Mp 194-195 °C (hexane-EtOAc). 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 7.59-7.49 (4H, m), 7.79-7.75 (1H, m), 7.87-7.89 (1H,
m), 8.13-8.11 (2H, m), 8.37-8.39 (1H, m), 8.47-8.49 (1H, m), 9.26 (1H,
s), 9.55 (1H, s). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 114.9, 115.6, 126.8, 127.2,
127.5, 127.8 (2 × C), 129.2 (2 × C), 129.5, 130.4, 131.2, 139.0, 146.6,
147.0, 149.8, 153.0, 154.4, 156.4. IR (KBr): 3055, 2376, 2347, 1582,
1557, 1502, 1477, 1409, 1368, 1325, 1219, 1090 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int):
323 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C20H13N5: C, 74.29; H, 4.05; N, 21.66.
Found: C, 74.33; H, 3.98; N, 21.61.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sequential three-component heterocyclization, one-pot multi-component
process

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7782-61-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 108-88-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Transamidation Reaction.
Amide (5.1 mmol) and amine (3.0 mmol) were dissolved or suspended in
toluene (3.0 mL), Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (61 mg, 0.15 mmol) was added, and the
mixture was refluxed until complete conversion (by TLC) of the amine. The
hot reaction mixture was filtered through a pad of Celite, concentrated,
and purified by flash chromatography as indicated below.
N-Benzylacetamide (7). The crude mixture was purified by flash
chromatography with DCM. N-(2-Hydroxyethyl)formamide (13k). The crude
mixture was purified by flash chromatography with DCM/MeOH (9:1). The
product was obtained as a pale yellow oil. Yield: 246 mg, 92%. 1H NMR
(300 MHz, DMSO): δ (ppm) 8.00 (s. 1H), 4.71 (t, J = 5.4 Hz, 1H),
3.36-3.43 (m, 2H), 3.09-3.17 (m, 2H). 13C{1H} NMR (75 MHz, DMSO): δ (ppm)
161.6, 60.1, 40.5. IR (ν, cm-1, KBr) 3380, 2888, 1666, 1538, 1389. MS
(EI) [M - OH]:71 (56), 58 (70), 43(52), 30 (100).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
2,2,5-Trimethyl-1,2-dihydro-8-phenyl-4H-pyrano-[4',3':4,5]pyrido[2,3-b]furo[3,2-d]pyrimidine
(IIa). A mixture of 1.7 g (5 mmole) of compound Ia with 20 ml formamide,
0.2 ml piperidine, and 0.2 ml acetic acid was heated to 200°C for 1 h and
cooled. The precipitated crystals were separated by filtration, washed
with water, dried, and recrystallized from an ethanol - chloroform (1:1)
mixture (Table 1). Compounds IIb - IIe were obtained using analogous
procedures (Table 1). Compound IIe 1H NMR spectra (δ, ppm): compound IIe,
9.19 (s, 1H, 10-CH), 8.54 (d, 2H, J 8.7 Hz, C6H4), 7.77 (d, 2H, J 8.7 Hz,
C6H4), 7.48-7.63 (m, 5H, C6H5), 4.84 (s, 2H, 4-CH2), 3.48 (s, 2H, 1-CH2),
1.42 (s, 6H, 2-CH3). M.p.: 246 - 248°C; R f: 0.71; Empirical formula:
C26H20BrN3O2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 31-365-CAS-5290004
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 92
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for Amination All the
experiments were carried out in a parallel synthesizer from REDLEYS
Discovery Technologies, UK. A solution of acid chloride 1a (1.0 gm 7.11
mmol) in formamide (10 ml) was heated to 100-120 °C and maintained at
same temperature for 5 to 6 hours, the reaction mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The reaction mass quenched in excess water and
extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic solvent was washed
with saturated NaHCO3 aqueous solution and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to give the residue
which was purified by column chromatography using silica gel and EtOAc=
hexane as eluent. An amount of 0.77 g (6.4 mmol, 90%) of 2a was obtained
as crystals. Compound 2b. Yield 92% Mp in °C (Lit): 192-195; Mp in °C
(Obs.):195-197
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM excess water used in stage 2, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Formamide as an ammonia synthon in amination of acid chlorides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srinivasan, S.; Manisankar, P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2010), 40(23), 3538-3543

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for CuI-catalyzed formation
of 3-substituted-4-quinazolines and 2,3-disubstituted-4(3H )-quinazolines
from 2-bromo-N-phenylbenzamide. For 3-substituted-4-quinazoline
(11a-11r). A Schlenk tube was charged with N-substituted 2-bromobenzamide
(0.25 mmol), CuI (5 mg, 0.025 mmol), trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline (3 mg,
0.025 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (163 mg, 0.5 mmol). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with argon before formamide (20 µL, 0.5 mmol) and 1 mL DMF was
added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 80 o C (or 90 o C for
substrate 7l) for 24 h. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, 5 mL of saturated NH4Cl solution was added. The mixture was
extracted with EtOAc and the organic layer was washed with water, brine
and dried over Na2SO4. After concentration in vacuo, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel. The desired
3-substituted 4-quinazoline. 3-Hexylquinazolin-4(3H)-one (11n). 53 mg,
92% yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.32 (dd, J 1= 1.2 Hz, J 2 = 8.0 Hz,
1H), 8.03 (s, 1H), 7.75-7.69 (m, 2H), 7.52 (dd, J 1 = 1.6 Hz, J 2 = 8.4
Hz, 1H), 4.01 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 1.83-1.76 (m, 2H), 1.38-1.30 (m, 6H),
0.90 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 161.13, 148.18,
146.71, 134.21, 127.46, 127.29, 126.78, 122.27, 47.19, 31.43, 29.44,
26.43, 22.58, 14.08. HRMS-ESI: m/z calcd for C14H19N2O [M + H]+:
231.1497, found 231.1498.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst formed in-situ; Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of 3-Substituted and 2,3-Disubstituted Quinazolinones via
Cu-Catalyzed Aryl Amidation

$DATUM Xu, Lanting; Jiang, Yongwen; Ma, Dawei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(4), 1150-1153

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for Amination All the
experiments were carried out in a parallel synthesizer from REDLEYS
Discovery Technologies, UK. A solution of acid chloride 1a (1.0 gm 7.11
mmol) in formamide (10 ml) was heated to 100-120 °C and maintained at
same temperature for 5 to 6 hours, the reaction mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The reaction mass quenched in excess water and
extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic solvent was washed
with saturated NaHCO3 aqueous solution and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to give the residue
which was purified by column chromatography using silica gel and EtOAc=
hexane as eluent. An amount of 0.77 g (6.4 mmol, 90%) of 2a was obtained
as crystals. Compound 2l. Yield 92% Mp in °C (Lit): 142-148; Mp in °C
(Obs.): 145-149
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM excess water used in stage 2, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Formamide as an ammonia synthon in amination of acid chlorides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srinivasan, S.; Manisankar, P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2010), 40(23), 3538-3543

$DATUM 25A To a solution of diethyl 5-amino-3-methyl-2,4-thiophenedicarboxylate
in formamide (16 mL) was added acetic acid (0.5 mL). The mixture was
heated at 150°C for 40 h, cooled to 70 °C and water was added (90 mL).
The suspension was cooled to rt with stirring. The solids were filtered,
washed with water (3x10 ml) and dried in air to give a yellow solid
(1.61g, 92%). 25A, Yield (1.61g, 92%).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: (25) General Procedure for the Synthesis of
Formanilides 2 To an open flask containing a solution of arylboronic acid
1 (1.0 mmol) in formamide (2 mL) were added Cu(OAc)2·H2O (19.9 mg, 10
mol%) and K2CO3 (138.2 mg, 1 mmol), and the mixture was stirred
vigorously at r.t. under air (without bubbling air) for 8-16 h (Table 2).
After completion of the reaction (indicated by TLC), the reaction mixture
was treated with EtOAc (5 mL) and H2O (5 mL). The organic layer was
separated, and the aqueous layer was extracted with EtOAc (3 × 5 mL). The
combined organic phase was washed with H2O (2 × 5 mL), dried over anhyd
Na2SO4, and concentrated to yield a residue, which was purified by flash
chromatography (prepacked silica cartridges). The clean product 2 as a
mixture of rotamers.27 All the products are known compounds and were
characterized by comparison of their melting points and spectral data
with those reported in the literature.14-17 N-Phenylformamide (2a, Table
2)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM aerobic, no solvent, Chan-Lam coupling
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper-catalyzed formamidation of arylboronic acids: direct access to
formanilides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srivastava, Vishnu P.; Yadav, Deepak K.; Yadav, Arvind K.; Watal, Geeta;
Yadav, Lal Dhar S.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2013), 24(11), 1423-1427

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
3-(4-Chlorophenyl)-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine(31), yield 92%.
Mp 196- 197 °C (hexane-EtOAc). 1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 7.34-7.38 (1H,
m), 7.48-7.58 (m, 4 H, ArH), 7.96-8.02 (2H, m), 8.24-8.30 (2H, m), 9.12
(1H, s), 9.46 (1H, s). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 114.0, 121.5 (2 × C),
127.0, 128.5 (2 × C), 129.3 (2 × C), 129.5 (2 × C), 130.0, 135.7, 138.4,
143.8, 152.6, 153.3, 155.7. IR (KBr): 3043, 2926, 2848, 1585, 1368, 1219,
1093 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 306 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C17H11ClN4:
C, 66.56; H, 3.61; N, 18.26. Found: C, 66.53; H, 3.62; N, 18.29.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Evaluation of Electrophilic Heteroaromatic Substitution: Synthesis of
Heteroaromatic-Fused Pyrimidine Derivatives via Sequential
Three-Component Heterocyclization

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 4-Hydroxy-5-(1-naphthylmethyl)-6(1H)-pyrimidinone (4a). A mixture of 3
(7.2 g, 30 mmol), formamide (5mL) and sodium ethoxide [prepared by
dissolving (2.8 g, 120 mmol) of sodium metal in 100 mL ethanol] was
refluxed for 12 h. The residue obtained after removal of ethanol in vacuo
was dissolved in warm water (100mL) and acidified with 4M HCl. The solid
product, which formed, was filtered off, dried and recrystallized from
water. 4a (92%) as white prisms. Mp 334- 336°C. 1H-NMR (DMSO-d6) δ 4.06
(s, 2H, CH2), 7.25 (d, 1H, J =7.1, arom.), 7.37 (t, 2H, J = 7.5 Hz,
arom.), .7.51 (m, 2H, arom.), 7.73 (d, 1H, J = 8.0 Hz, arom.), 7.87 (d,
1H, J =8.3Hz, arom.), 8.03 (s, 1H, C2-H), 8.37 (d, 111..J = 7.3 Hz,
arom.); 11.85 (s. br„ 1H, NH). 13C-NMR (DMSO-d6) δ 25.26 (CH2), 100.64
(C-5) 124.05, 125.34, 125.64, 126.04, 128.28; 131.83, 133.24, and 135.96
(C-arom.), 147.45 (C-2). 164.51 (C-4 and CO). Anal. Calcd for C15H12N2O2
(252.37): C, 71.38; H, 4.79; N, 11.14. Found: C, 71.60; H, 4.90; N,
11.30.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Nucleic acid component analogues: Synthesis of 2'-deoxynucleosides from

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 10 - Preparation of
1-isopropyl-3-(3-nitrophenyl)-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-4(5H)-one (28)
Compound 27 (1 g, 3.46 mmol) was added to formamide (1.167 mL, 29.3 mmol)
and heated to 160°C for 40 hours. Afterwards, the reaction mixture was
allowed to cool to room temperature and diluted into ice cold water. The
mixture was filtered and was collected. Yield 943 mg, 91%, solid. 1H NMR
(400 MHz, DMSO) δ 12.37 (s, 1H), 9.32 (s, 1H), 8.81 (d, J = 7.8, 1H),
8.23 (d, J = 8.1, 1H), 8.13 (s, 1H), 7.75 (t, J = 8.0, 1H), 5.06 (hept, J
= 6.6, 1H), 1.52 (d, J = 6.7, 6H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, DMSO) δ 157.77,
152.48, 148.16, 148.06, 143.85,133.58, 129.95,123.05, 122.07, 103.02,
49.07, 21.74; [M+H]+ calculated for C14H13N5O3 300.1, found 300.0.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of pyrazolopyrimidine and quinazoline derivatives as
inhibitors of kinase
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 22 - Preparation of
3-(3-bromobenzyl)-1-isopropyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidin-4-amine
Compound 34 (6.09 g, 19.1 mmol) was added to formamide (26.6 mL, 668
mmol) and heated to 160°C for 27 hours. Afterwards, the reaction mixture
was allowed to cool to room temperature and diluted into ice cold water
(50 mL). A viscous material was filtered and dissolved in EtOAc. This
solution was washed with brine and concentrated in vacuo. Yield 6.23 g,
91%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO) δ 8.13 (s, 1H), 7.49 (s, 1H), 7.37 (dt, J =
7.5, 1.7, 1H), 7.22 (m, 2H), 4.95 (hept, J = 6.6, 1H), 4.38 (s, 2H), 1.43
(d, J = 6.7, 6H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, DMSO) δ 157.90, 155.39, 153.22,
142.01, 141.86, 131.16, 130.52, 129.00, 127.40, 121.56, 98.39, 47.76,
32.66, 21.71; [M+H]+ calculated for C15H16BrN5 346.0, 348.0 found 346.0:
348.0.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

inhibitors of kinase

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine
(3a) To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk-tube equipped with a stirbar was
added Pd2(dba)3 · CHCl3 (20.8 mg, 0.02 mmol),
2-Di-t-butylphosphino-3,4,5,6-tetramethyl-2',4',6'-tri-i-propylbiphenyl
(L1) (48 mg, 0.1 mmol), K3PO4 (639 mg, 3.01 mmol) and
2-Chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)pyridin-3-amine (2a) (500 mg, 2.01 mmol) (if
solid). The tube was evacuated and refilled with Ar(g). Formamide (0.12
mL, 3.01 mmol) was added via syringe as a single portion, followed by the
chloropyridine (if liquid) in 4 mL of tert-butanol. The reaction mixture
was degassed with 3 x vacuum / Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction vessel
was then equipped with a cold-finger under a positive pressure of argon
gas and immersed in a 110°C pre-heated oil-bath for 4h at which time TLC
showed consumption of the chloro-pyridine. The reaction was cooled to
room temperature, diluted with MeOH (4 mL) filtered through a Celite plug
and concentrated to give a dark brown oil. The crude product was purified
on a silica gel column (4.5 cm x 12 cm), eluting with 4% MeOH in CH2Cl2.
1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-7-methyl-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine (10) Following the
general experimental;
2-chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)-4-methylpyridin-3-amine (4) (93 mg, 0.4
mmol), Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol), L1 (9.6 mg, 0.02 mmol),
K3PO4 (128 mg, 0.6 mmol), formamide (0.022 mL, 0.6 mmol) were combined
with 2.0 mL tert-butanol in a 25 mL Schlenk flask. After 4 h the reaction
was complete, the reaction cooled to RT, filtered through Celite,
concentrated and purified on a silica gel column (2.5 cm x 12 cm),
eluting with 4% MeOH / CH2Cl2. 10 as 92 mg of a green solid (91%). 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.34 (d, J = 4.8 Hz, 1H), 8.01 (s, 1H), 6.93-6.77
(m, 5H), 5.44 (s, 2H), 3.74 (s, 3H), 2.43 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (75.4 MHz,
CDCl3) δ = 159.5, 156.5, 146.2, 145.1, 131.4, 128.3, 127.3, 125.6, 120.8,
114.6, 55.4, 50.3, 17.9; FT-IR (NaCl, thin film) ν = 3053, 2959, 2933,
2837, 1696, 1608, 1586, 1513, 1493, 1357, 1249, 1178, 1031, 821 cm-1.
Anal. Calc C15H15N3O: C, 71.13; H, 5.97; N, 16.59; found C, 71.43; H,
5.81; N, 16.61; MP: 105-108°C.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for CuI-catalyzed formation
of 3-substituted-4-quinazolines and 2,3-disubstituted-4(3H )-quinazolines
from 2-bromo-N-phenylbenzamide. For 3-substituted-4-quinazoline
(11a-11r). A Schlenk tube was charged with N-substituted 2-bromobenzamide
(0.25 mmol), CuI (5 mg, 0.025 mmol), trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline (3 mg,
0.025 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (163 mg, 0.5 mmol). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with argon before formamide (20 µL, 0.5 mmol) and 1 mL DMF was
added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 80 o C (or 90 o C for
substrate 7l) for 24 h. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, 5 mL of saturated NH4Cl solution was added. The mixture was
extracted with EtOAc and the organic layer was washed with water, brine
and dried over Na2SO4. After concentration in vacuo, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel. The desired
3-substituted 4-quinazoline. 3-p-Tolylquinazolin-4(3H)-one (11h).1 54 mg,
91% yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.37 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 1H), 8.11 (s,
1H), 7.81-7.49 (m, 2H), 7.56 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 1H), 7.35-7.28 (m, 4H), 2.43
(s, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 161.02, 148.04, 146.42, 139.37,
135.05, 134.63, 130.37 (2C), 127.69 (2C), 127.31, 126.86 (2C), 122.54,
21.34. HRMS-ESI: m/z calcd for C15H13N2O [M + H]+: 237.1028, found
237.1022.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst formed in-situ; Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of 3-Substituted and 2,3-Disubstituted Quinazolinones via
Cu-Catalyzed Aryl Amidation

$DATUM Xu, Lanting; Jiang, Yongwen; Ma, Dawei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(4), 1150-1153

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Experimental D: Palladium Amidation of
3-Amino-4-chloropyridines. To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk tube equipped
with a stirbar were added Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (1 mol %), Me3(OMe)t-BuXPhos (5
mol %), K3PO4 (1.5 equiv), and pyridine 3 (1 equiv). The reaction vessel
was evacuated under vacuum and refilled with Ar(g).t-BuOH (0.2 M) and
formamide (1.5 equiv) were then added via syringe, and the reaction
mixture was degassed by three vacuum/Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction
vessel was then equipped with a coldfinger condenser, placed in a
preheated 110°C oil bath, and stirred for the specified time. Upon
consumption of pyridine 3 (as judged by TLC analysis), the reaction
mixture was allowed to cool to room temperature. The reaction mixture was
diluted with methanol and passed through a Celite plug. The crude mixture
was concentrated in vacuo and applied to a silica gel column eluted with
the indicated solvent mixture(s) to give the desired product.
3-Benzyl-3H-imidazo[4,5-c]pyridine (4a). 37 Following general procedure
D: Pyridine 3a (88 mg, 0.4 mmol), Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol),
Me3(OMe)-tert-butyl-XPhos26 (10 mg, 0.02 mmol), K3PO4 (128 mg, 0.6 mmol),
and formamide (0.024 mL, 0.6 mmol) were combined with 2 mL of tert-butyl
alcohol in a 25 mL Schlenk tube. After 4 h, TLC analysis indicated the
reaction was complete. The reaction mixture was cooled to rt, filtered
through Celite, concentrated in vacuo, and purified on a silica gel
column, eluted with 3% MeOH/DCM.
3-(4-(Trifluoromethyl)phenyl)-3H-imidazo[4,5-c]pyridine (4j). Following
general procedure D: Pyridine 3j (108 mg, 0.4 mmol), Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3(4
mg, 0.004 mmol), Me3(OMe)-tert-butyl-XPhos26 (10 mg, 0.02 mmol), K3PO4
(128 mg, 0.6 mmol), and formamide (0.024 mL, 0.6 mmol) were combined with
2 mL of tert-butyl alcohol in a 25 mL Schlenk tube. After 6 h, TLC
analysis indicated the reaction was complete. The reaction mixture was
cooled to rt,filtered through Celite, concentrated in vacuo, and purified
on a silica gel column, eluted with 4% MeOH/DCM. 96 mg of pyridine 4j
(91%) as a pale yellow solid. Mp 166-167°C; R f = 0.30 (5% MeOH/DCM); 1H
NMR (600 MHz, CDCl3 ) δ = 8.97 (s, 1H), 8.52 (d, J = 5.7 Hz, 1H), 8.25
(s, 1H), 7.88 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.76 (d, J = 5.7 Hz, 1H), 7.69 (d, J =
8.4 Hz, 2H); 13C NMR (150 MHz, CDCl3 ) δ = 149.4, 144.4, 143.1, 138.5,
133.9, 131.0, 130.8 (q, J C-F = 33.3 Hz), 127.8 (q, J C-F = 3.7 Hz),
123.9, 123.5 (q, J C-F = 272.9 Hz), 115.5; 19F NMR (282.3 MHz, CDCl3 ) δ
=-63.0; FT-IR (NaCl, thinfilm) ν = 3056, 1606, 1334, 1106 cm-1 . Anal.
Calcd for C13H8F3N3 : C, 59.32; H, 3.06; N, 15.96. Found: C, 59.04; H,
2.77; N, 15.67.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine
(3a) To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk-tube equipped with a stirbar was
added Pd2(dba)3 · CHCl3 (20.8 mg, 0.02 mmol),
2-Di-t-butylphosphino-3,4,5,6-tetramethyl-2',4',6'-tri-i-propylbiphenyl
(L1) (48 mg, 0.1 mmol), K3PO4 (639 mg, 3.01 mmol) and
2-Chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)pyridin-3-amine (2a) (500 mg, 2.01 mmol) (if
solid). The tube was evacuated and refilled with Ar(g). Formamide (0.12
mL, 3.01 mmol) was added via syringe as a single portion, followed by the
chloropyridine (if liquid) in 4 mL of tert-butanol. The reaction mixture
was degassed with 3 x vacuum / Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction vessel
was then equipped with a cold-finger under a positive pressure of argon
gas and immersed in a 110°C pre-heated oil-bath for 4h at which time TLC
showed consumption of the chloro-pyridine. The reaction was cooled to
room temperature, diluted with MeOH (4 mL) filtered through a Celite plug
and concentrated to give a dark brown oil. The crude product was purified
on a silica gel column (4.5 cm x 12 cm), eluting with 4% MeOH in CH2Cl2.
1-Isopropyl-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine (3h) Following the general
experimental; 2-chloro-N-isopropylpyridin-3-amine (2h) (68 mg, 0.4 mmol),
Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol), t-BuBrettphos (9.7 mg, 0.02 mmol),
K3PO4 (128 mg, 0.6 mmol), formamide (0.022 mL, 0.6 mmol) were combined
with 2.0 mL tert-butanol in a 25 mL Schlenk flask. After 3 h the reaction
was complete, the reaction cooled to RT, filtered through Celite,
concentrated and purified on a silica gel column (2.5 cm x 12 cm),
eluting with 4% MeOH / CH2Cl2. 3h as 59 mg of a white solid (91%). 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.53 (dd, J = 4.5 Hz, 1.2 Hz, 1H), 8.19 (s, 1H),
7.75 (dd, J = 8.1 Hz, 1.5 Hz, 1H), 7.20 (dd, J = 8.1 Hz, 4.8 Hz, 1H),
4.63 (sept, J = 6.6 Hz, 1H), 1.61 (d, J = 6.6 Hz, 6H); 13C NMR (75.4 MHz,
CDCl3) δ = 156.4, 144.9, 142.6, 125.5, 118.5, 117.9, 48.6, 22.6; FT-IR
(NaCl, thin film) ν = 2980, 2936, 1607, 1488, 1397, 1306, 1282, 1225, 786
cm-1. HRMS (ESI) Calc (C9H11N3)H+: 162.1026, Found: 162.1033; MP:
134-136°C; Rf (4% MeOH / CH2Cl2): 0.25.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM thermal, Schlenk tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of Imidazo[4,5-b]pyridines and Imidazo[4,5-b]pyrazines by
Palladium Catalyzed Amidation of 2-Chloro-3-amino-heterocycles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Rosenberg, Adam J.; Zhao, Jinbo; Clark, Daniel A.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(7), 1764-1767

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
3-(4-Chlorophenyl)-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine(31).25 The
standard procedure involved the treatment of
5-amino-3-(4-chlorophenyl)-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazole (15; 99 mg, 0.32 mmol,
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (90 μL, 0.97 mmol, 3 equiv) in formamide solution (2
mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
31: 91% yield (89 mg), light yellow solid. Mp 196- 197 °C (hexane-EtOAc).
1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 7.34-7.38 (1H, m), 7.48-7.58 (m, 4 H, ArH),
7.96-8.02 (2H, m), 8.24-8.30 (2H, m), 9.12 (1H, s), 9.46 (1H, s). 13C NMR
(125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 114.0, 121.5 (2 × C), 127.0, 128.5 (2 × C), 129.3 (2
× C), 129.5 (2 × C), 130.0, 135.7, 138.4, 143.8, 152.6, 153.3, 155.7. IR
(KBr): 3043, 2926, 2848, 1585, 1368, 1219, 1093 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int):
306 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C17H11ClN4: C, 66.56; H, 3.61; N, 18.26.
Found: C, 66.53; H, 3.62; N, 18.29.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sequential three-component heterocyclization, one-pot multi-component
process
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Evaluation of Electrophilic Heteroaromatic Substitution: Synthesis of
Heteroaromatic-Fused Pyrimidine Derivatives via Sequential
Three-Component Heterocyclization

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Example 6: Preparation of 4-amino
furopyrimidine-based compound
4-amino-6-(4-chlorophenyl)furo[2,3,d]Pyrimidine(Vla) 20ml of formamide
was applied dropwisely to the 4.37 g (20 mmol) of 2-
amino-3-cyano-5-(4-chlorophenyl)furan (IVa) obtained in Example 5, which
was heated and refluxed for 12 hours and then cooled at a room
temperature. 100 ml of water was added thereto, and a generated solid was
filtered, which was washed with water and n-hexane sufficiently, and
then, dried. Thereafter, the resultant material was re-crystallized with
acetone and ethylalcohol to obtain a brown-colored solid product of
4-amino-6-(4-chlorophenyl)furo[2,3,d]pyrimidine (VIa). Compounds Vlb to
VIy of table 4 were also obtained, respectively, according to the same
method. [Table 4] VId, yield 91% Table 4 shows analysis results of the
obtained 4-amino furopyrimidine based compound VIa to VIy 1H NMR (400 MHz
DMSO-d6) δ (ppm) : 8.17 (s, 1H), 7.72 (d, J = 8.8 Hz, 2H), 7.57 (d, J =
8.8 Hz, 2H), 7.28-7.13 (br s, 2H), 2.51 (s, 3H)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of furo[2,3-d]pyrimidines as inhibitors of DDR2 (discoidin
domain receptor 2) tyrosine kinase.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Yang, Beom-Seok; Yang, Kyung-Mi; Kim, Hae-Jong; Park, In-Sung; Park,
Sung-Dae; Lee, Jang-Hyuk; Kwon, Hyuk-Man; Woo, Byoung-Young
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2005092896 A1 2005-10-06

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
N,N′-Diarylformamidines (50-56 and 73). The reliable procedure involved
the treatment of arylamines (43-49; 1.0 equiv) or 3-aminopyridine (68;
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60
°C over 0.5-1.0 h. When the reaction was complete, the crude solid was
triturated in cold n-pentane and filtered through a glass frit with
suction. Then the solid was washed with n-pentane and dried in vacuo to
give the crude formamidines (50-56 and 73). The crude products were
recrystallized from the mixture of acetone and diisopropyl ether to give
the corresponding N,N′-diarylformamidine products (50-56 and 73) in
88-97% yields as white to light yellow solids.
N,N'-Bis(2-fluorohenyl)formamidine (54).35 The standard procedure
involved the treatment of 2-fluoroaniline (47; 51 mg, 0.53 mmol, 1.0
equiv) with PBr3 (0.15 mL, 1.6 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2
mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
54: 91% yield (112 mg), yellow oil (CH2Cl2- methanol). 1H NMR (CDCl3, 200
MHz): δ 6.42-6.46 (1H, m), 6.57-6.61 (1H, m), 6.70-6.76 (2H, m),
7.08-7.12 (2H, m), 7.21- 7.25 (2H, m), 7.61 (1H, s), 7.92 (1H, s). 13C
NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3): δ 114.3, 116.3, 118.4, 125.5, 124.4 (2 × C), 127.9
(2 × C), 128.1, 137.5, 153.9, 156.1, 162.8. IR (KBr): 3127, 2951, 2847,
1637, 1561, 1494, 1456, 1277, 1232, 1207, 1175, 1121, 1038 cm-1. EIMS m/
z (rel int): 232 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C13H10F2N2: C, 67.24; H,
4.32; N, 12.06. Found: C, 67.22; H, 4.31; N, 12.01.

$DATUM R-XIX. a. N-(4-Amino-benzyl)-fromamide (62). A total of 0.5 mL of
4-amino-benzylamine (4 mmol) was dissolved in 3 mL formamide, heated to
80 °C and reacted for 4 h, when the reaction was completed (GC). The
reaction mixture was poured into 20 mL of water and extracted with 3 × 20
mL of ethylacetate. The organic phase collected was evaporated under
pressure, yielding a thick liquid (0.5 g; 91.0%). MS(EI): M+(measured) =
150.1; M+(calc) = 150.2; minor (trans) 1H NMR (ppm): 4.24 (2H, d, 6 Hz,
CH2), 5.00 (2H, bs, NH2), 7.20-7.35 (2H, dd, 2.6 Hz, 8.4 Hz, CH3,5),
7.50-7.70 (2H, dd, 1.0 Hz, 8.4 Hz, CH2,6), 7.96 (1H, dd, 1.4 Hz, 13.1 Hz,
CHO), 8.20 (1H, bs, NH); 13C NMR (ppm): 40.83 (CH2), 114.13 (2C, CH3,5),
126.10 (1C, C1), 128.65 (2C, CH2,6), 147.88 (1C, C4), 165.05 (1C, CHO);
major (cis) 1H NMR (ppm): 4.08 (2H, d, 6 Hz, CH2), 5.00 (2H, bs, NH2),
6.49 (2H, dd, 2.6 Hz, 8.4 Hz, CH3,5), 6.9 (2H, dd, 1.0 Hz, 8.4 Hz,
CH2,6), 8.05 (1H, dd, 0.9 Hz, 0.3 Hz, CHO), 8.10 (1H, bs, NH); 13C NMR
(ppm): 40.83 (CH2), 114.13 (2C, CH3,5) 126.10 (1C, C1), 128.45 (2C,
CH2,6), 147.88 (1C, C4), 163.32 (1C, CHO).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(4-Methoxybenzyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine
(3a) To an oven-dried 25 mL Schlenk-tube equipped with a stirbar was
added Pd2(dba)3 · CHCl3 (20.8 mg, 0.02 mmol),
2-Di-t-butylphosphino-3,4,5,6-tetramethyl-2',4',6'-tri-i-propylbiphenyl
(L1) (48 mg, 0.1 mmol), K3PO4 (639 mg, 3.01 mmol) and
2-Chloro-N-(4-methoxybenzyl)pyridin-3-amine (2a) (500 mg, 2.01 mmol) (if
solid). The tube was evacuated and refilled with Ar(g). Formamide (0.12
mL, 3.01 mmol) was added via syringe as a single portion, followed by the
chloropyridine (if liquid) in 4 mL of tert-butanol. The reaction mixture
was degassed with 3 x vacuum / Ar(g) purge cycles. The reaction vessel
was then equipped with a cold-finger under a positive pressure of argon
gas and immersed in a 110°C pre-heated oil-bath for 4h at which time TLC
showed consumption of the chloro-pyridine. The reaction was cooled to
room temperature, diluted with MeOH (4 mL) filtered through a Celite plug
and concentrated to give a dark brown oil. The crude product was purified
on a silica gel column (4.5 cm x 12 cm), eluting with 4% MeOH in CH2Cl2.
1-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-b]pyridine (3p) Following the general
experimental; 2-chloro-N-(4-methoxyphenyl)pyridin-3-amine (2p) (85 mg,
0.36 mmol), Pd2(dba)3·CHCl3 (4.14 mg, 0.004 mmol), t-BuBrettPhos (9.7 mg,
0.02 mmol), K3PO4 (128 mg, 0.6 mmol), formamide (0.022 mL, 0.6 mmol) were
combined with 1.8 mL tert-butanol in a 25 mL Schlenk flask. After 3 h the
reaction was complete, the reaction cooled to RT, filtered through
Celite, concentrated and purified on a silica gel column (2.5 cm x 12
cm), eluting with 4% MeOH / CH2Cl2. 3p as 74 mg of a white solid (91%).
1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.54 (dd, J = 4.8 Hz, 1.8 Hz, 1H), 8.23 (s,
1H), 7.73 (dd, J = 8.1 Hz, 1.5 Hz, 1H), 7.35 (dd, J = 9 Hz, 2.4 Hz, 2H),
7.20 (dd, J = 8.1 Hz, 4.8 Hz, 1H), 7.05 (dd, J = 9 Hz, 2.1 Hz, 2H), 3.85
(s, 3H); 13C NMR (75.4 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 159.7, 156.3, 145.4, 144.5, 129.4,
126.6, 125.5, 118.7, 118.6, 115.4, 55.7; FT-IR (NaCl, thin film) ν =
3401, 3080, 2963, 2839, 1609, 1517, 1489, 1415, 1252, 1030, 975, 836
cm-1. HRMS (ESI) Calc (C13H12O1N3): 226.0975, Found: 226.0971; MP:
125-129°C; Rf (4% MeOH / CH2Cl2): 0.24.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 51-35-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for CuI-catalyzed formation
of 3-substituted-4-quinazolines and 2,3-disubstituted-4(3H )-quinazolines
from 2-bromo-N-phenylbenzamide. For 3-substituted-4-quinazoline
(11a-11r). A Schlenk tube was charged with N-substituted 2-bromobenzamide
(0.25 mmol), CuI (5 mg, 0.025 mmol), trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline (3 mg,
0.025 mmol), and Cs2CO3 (163 mg, 0.5 mmol). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with argon before formamide (20 µL, 0.5 mmol) and 1 mL DMF was
added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 80 o C (or 90 o C for
substrate 7l) for 24 h. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, 5 mL of saturated NH4Cl solution was added. The mixture was
extracted with EtOAc and the organic layer was washed with water, brine
and dried over Na2SO4. After concentration in vacuo, the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel. The desired
3-substituted 4-quinazoline. 3-(4-Methoxyphenyl)quinazolin-4(3H)-one
(11i). 2 57 mg, 91% yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.37 (dd, J 1 = 0.4
Hz, J 2 = 8.0 Hz, 1H), 8.11 (s, 1H), 7.80-7.77 (m, 2H), 7.56 (t, J = 6.4

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
Pyrido[3,2-h]quinazoline (67).27 The standard procedure involved the
treatment of 8-aminoquinoline (63; 97 mg, 0.81 mmol, 1.0 equiv) with PBr3
(0.23 mL, 2.4 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C
over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up, and the residue
was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure 67: 91% yield
(133 mg), light yellow solid. Mp 171- 172 °C (CH2Cl2-methanol). 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 200 MHz): δ 7.13- 7.19 (1H, m), 7.46-7.51 (1H, m), 7.72-7.76 (1H,
m), 7.82-7.86 (1H, m), 8.69-8.73 (1H, m), 9.12 (1H, s), 9.17 (1H, s). 13C
NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3): δ 119.3, 124.8, 126.6 (2 × C), 127.1, 133.8, 148.4,
152.3, 154.7. IR (KBr): 3047, 2924, 1612, 1582, 1503, 1431, 1356, 1254,
1219, 1092 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 181 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for
C11H7N3: C, 72.92; H, 3.89; N, 23.19. Found: C, 72.88; H, 3.86; N, 23.22.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

process

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
1-(4-Chlorophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine (23). The
standard procedure involved the treatment of
5-amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole (7; 106 mg, 0.35 mmol,
1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (0.10 mL, 1.0 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution
(2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked
up, and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give
pure 23: 91% yield (97 mg), yellow solid. M,p 144-145 °C (hexane-EtOAc).
1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 7.46-7.52 (3H, m), 7.52-7.58 (2H, m),
8.00-8.06 (2H, m), 8.29- 8.35 (2H, m), 9.12 (1H, s), 9.49 (1H, s). 13C
NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 114.3, 122.2 (2 × C), 127.4 (2 × C), 129.2 (2 ×
C), 129.3 (2 × C), 129.8, 131.3, 132.1, 137.2, 145.2, 152.9, 153.4,
155.7. IR (KBr): 3051, 2922, 2851, 2384, 2349, 1589, 1554, 1406, 1367,
1215 cm-1. EIMS m/z (rel int): 306 (100, M+). Anal. Calcd for C17H11ClN4:
C, 66.56; H, 3.61; N, 18.26. Found: C, 66.53; H, 3.58; N, 18.23.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sequential three-component heterocyclization, one-pot multi-component
process

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM N-(2,2-Diphenyl-1-methylethenyl)formamide (Table 2, entry 9). A Schlenk
tube was charged with Pd2dba3 (18.3 mg, 0.0200 mmol, 4.0 mol% Pd), dipf
(33.5 mg, 0.0800 mmol, 8.0 mol%), 2,2-diphenyl-1-methylethenyl tosylate
(364 mg, 1.00 mmol), K3PO4 (425 mg, 2.00 mmol), evacuated and backfilled
with N2. Formamide (80 μL, 2.01 mmol) and tert-amyl alcohol (4.0 mL) were
added. The Schlenk tube was sealed and the reaction mixture was stirred
at 100 °C for 20 h. The resulting brown suspension was filtered eluting
with MeOH (30 mL). The filtrate was concentrated and the residue was
purified by flash chromatography on silica gel (hexane:EtOAc = 2:1).
Fractions containing the product were repurified by flash chromatography
on silica gel (CH2Cl2:hexane:EtOAc = 8:4:1) to provide 216 mg of the
desired enamide (91% yield) as a white solid.
N-(2,2-Diphenyl-1-methylethenyl)formamide (Table 2, entry 9), yield 216
mg (91%) Mp: 115-116 °C; NMR spectra displayed two sets of signals (6:1
ratio) due to amide rotamers. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.58 (d, J = 11.5
Hz, 0.86H), 8.08 (d, J = 1.7 Hz, 0.14H), 7.46 (br d, J = 11.5 Hz, 0.86H),
7.40-7.13 (m, 10H), 6.83 (br s, 0.14H), 2.36 (s, 0.42H), 2.18 (s, 2.58H)
ppm; 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3; mj = major, mn = minor sets of signals) δ
160.7 (mj), 159.1 (mn), 140.4 (mj), 138.9 (mj), 130.1 (mj), 129.9 (mn),
129.7 (mj), 129.6 (mn), 129.3 (mj), 129.0 (mn), 128.3 (mj), 128.2 (mn),
127.70 (mj), 127.68 (mj), 127.4 (mn), 126.9 (mj), 123.9 (mj), 18.1 (mn),
16.2 (mj) ppm; IR (neat) cm-1; Anal. Calcd. for C16H15NO: C, 80.98; H,
6.37; N, 5.90. Found: C, 80.94; H, 6.28; N, 5.82.

$DATUM <Step 1 > Preparation of 7-methy3H-thieno[3,2-d]pyrimidin-4-one
3-amino-4-methylhiophene-2-carboxylic acid methyl ester (10.2 g, 59.6
mmol) was dissolved in formamide (25 mL), followed by refluxing for 24
hours at 200°C. The reaction solution was slowly cooled to room
temperature. The resulting solid was filtered, washed with diethyl ether,
and dried to obtain the title compound. Yield (9 g, 91%). 1 Spectrum (300
MHz, DMSO-d6): δ 8.17 (s, 1H), 7.81 (s, 1H), 2.31 (s, 3H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Standard Procedure for Synthesis of
Pyrazolo[3,4-d]-pyrimidines (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76). The reliable
procedure involved the treatment of 5-aminopyrazoles (1-16; 1.0 equiv),
5- amino-4-formylpyrazoles (37-41; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminoquinoline (61; 1.0
equiv), 8-aminoquinoline (62; 1.0 equiv), 5-aminopyrimidine (68; 1.0
equiv), or 2-aminopyrazines (69-71; 1.0 equiv) with PBr3 (~ 3 equiv) in
formamide solution (2 mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1 h. When the reaction was
complete, the reaction mixture was added to saturated sodium bicarbonate
(15 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (15 mL). The organic extracts
were dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under reduced pressure.
The residue solution was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to give the corresponding aromatic or heterocyclic fused pyrimidine
products (17-32, 65, 66, and 73-76) in 82-96% yields.
1-(2-Chlorophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazolo[3,4-d]pyrimidine (19). The
standard procedure involved the treatment of
5-amino-1-(2-chlorophenyl)-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole (3; 99 mg, 0.32 mmol, 1.0
equiv) with PBr3 (0.09 mL, 0.97 mmol, 3.0 equiv) in formamide solution (2
mL) at 50-60 °C over 0.5-1.0 h. The reaction mixture was then worked up,
and the residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel to give pure
19: 91% yield (89 mg), yellow solid. Mp 142-143 °C (hexane-EtOAc). 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 500 MHz): δ 7.43-7.49 (3H, m), 7.50-7.56 (2H, m), 7.57-7.65 (2H,
m), 8.02-8.08 (2H, m), 9.07 (1H, s), 9.52 (1H, s). 13C NMR (125 MHz,
CDCl3): δ 122.9, 127.3 (2 × C), 127.6, 129.2 (2 × C), 129.6 (2 × C),
130.7 (2 × C), 131.4, 132.1, 134.7, 145.6, 152.8, 154.5, 155.9. IR (KBr):
3061, 2924, 2370, 2349, 1581, 1557, 1516, 1497, 1304, 1223, 1088 cm-1.
EIMS m/z (rel int): 306 (89, M+). Anal. Calcd for C17H11ClN4: C, 66.56;
H, 3.61; N, 18.26. Found: C, 66.59; H, 3.58; N, 18.22.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sequential three-component heterocyclization, one-pot multi-component
process
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Evaluation of Electrophilic Heteroaromatic Substitution: Synthesis of
Heteroaromatic-Fused Pyrimidine Derivatives via Sequential
Three-Component Heterocyclization
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Wong, Fung Fuh; Huang, Yu-Ying; Chang, Chun-Hsi

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for Amination All the
experiments were carried out in a parallel synthesizer from REDLEYS
Discovery Technologies, UK. A solution of acid chloride 1a (1.0 gm 7.11
mmol) in formamide (10 ml) was heated to 100-120 °C and maintained at
same temperature for 5 to 6 hours, the reaction mixture was cooled to
room temperature. The reaction mass quenched in excess water and
extracted with dichloromethane. The combined organic solvent was washed
with saturated NaHCO3 aqueous solution and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4.
The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure to give the residue
which was purified by column chromatography using silica gel and EtOAc=
hexane as eluent. An amount of 0.77 g (6.4 mmol, 90%) of 2a was obtained
as crystals. Compound 2e. Yield 91% Mp in °C (Lit): 191-194; Mp in °C
(Obs.): 190-192
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM excess water used in stage 2, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Formamide as an ammonia synthon in amination of acid chlorides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Srinivasan, S.; Manisankar, P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2010), 40(23), 3538-3543
